subject: Install qemu-kvm instead of kvm package on Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 07:18:42.000000000', 'files': ['files/apts/nova', 'lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt'], 'message': 'Install qemu-kvm instead of kvm package on Ubuntu

Since at least 12.04, the kvm package is a transitional dummy
package intended to move users to the newer qemu-kvm package.  This
removes the dependency on this dummy package, which will be going away
in 14.04, and instead depends on the proper qemu-kvm package.

Change-Id: I4a88ada3cf32106413a9fae6fe77c9c4c28a524e
Closes-bug: #1294557

commit_message:
Install qemu-kvm instead of kvm package on Ubuntu

Since at least 12.04, the kvm package is a transitional dummy
package intended to move users to the newer qemu-kvm package.  This
removes the dependency on this dummy package, which will be going away
in 14.04, and instead depends on the proper qemu-kvm package.

Change-Id: I4a88ada3cf32106413a9fae6fe77c9c4c28a524e
Closes-bug: #1294557

commit_message:
Change exception type from HTTPBadRequest to HTTPForbidden

When user without admin permission wants to get a list of servers
which are in 'deleted' state, currently it raises  HTTPBadRequest.
This should be changed to HTTPForbidden exception.

Change-Id: I29da5f055c69e8aba66ffb068a3601ae69b2fc94
Closes-Bug: #1281904

commit_message:
Ironic api-endpoint uses port 6385

The Ironic api_endpoint value in nova.conf (ironic section) is incorrectly
set to port 6358. This sets it to the correct port: 6385.

Change-Id: Ic591588e3480cc25c6e276f11103b7b0007d642a
Closes-Bug: #1297939

subject: Persistence cleanup part one
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-26 20:30:46.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/server.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/persistence/base.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_zookeeper.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/84d6e888850_add_task_detail_type.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_analyzer.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_memory.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/retry_action.py', 'taskflow/engines/worker_based/protocol.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_server.py', 'taskflow/utils/persistence_utils.py', 'taskflow/persistence/logbook.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_duration.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_protocol.py', 'taskflow/listeners/timing.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_executor.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_action_engine.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_retries.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/589dccdf2b6e_rename_taskdetails_to_atomdetails.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/base.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_dir.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_progress.py', 'taskflow/utils/misc.py'], 'message': "Persistence cleanup part one

- Convert the various functions that take a task detail into
  ones that take atom details (since this is now the generic
  type they should take).
- Don't expose the detail type strings as part of the atom
  detail api, leave those as private hidden strings and provide
  conversion functions from string<->class instead.
- Have the logbook objects contain the following new methods
  to reduce the dependence on persistence_utils to do the same.
  - to_dict() which converts the current object into a dict
  - from_dict() which converts the provided dict into a object
  - merge() which merges a incoming objects data with the current
    objects
- Have the persistence backends + storage + action engine use these
  new methods instead of there current usage.
- Don't compare to logbook.RETRY_DETAIL or logbook.TASK_DETAIL since
  python has the isinstance function just use it (ideally we should
  fix the code so that this isn't even needed, usage of isinstance
  means something is not designed/structured right).
- In storage tests we can't assume that failures will be non-lossy
  since under certain backends when a failure is stored information
  about the internally held exc_info is lost, so take this into
  account when testing by using matches() where applicable.

Change-Id: Ie8a274cfd4cb4e64e87c355dc99d466d74a4e82c
"}]
commit_message:
Persistence cleanup part one

- Convert the various functions that take a task detail into
  ones that take atom details (since this is now the generic
  type they should take).
- Don't expose the detail type strings as part of the atom
  detail api, leave those as private hidden strings and provide
  conversion functions from string<->class instead.
- Have the logbook objects contain the following new methods
  to reduce the dependence on persistence_utils to do the same.
  - to_dict() which converts the current object into a dict
  - from_dict() which converts the provided dict into a object
  - merge() which merges a incoming objects data with the current
    objects
- Have the persistence backends + storage + action engine use these
  new methods instead of there current usage.
- Don't compare to logbook.RETRY_DETAIL or logbook.TASK_DETAIL since
  python has the isinstance function just use it (ideally we should
  fix the code so that this isn't even needed, usage of isinstance
  means something is not designed/structured right).
- In storage tests we can't assume that failures will be non-lossy
  since under certain backends when a failure is stored information
  about the internally held exc_info is lost, so take this into
  account when testing by using matches() where applicable.

Change-Id: Ie8a274cfd4cb4e64e87c355dc99d466d74a4e82c

commit_message:
Handle IpAddressGenerationClient neutron

Handles IpAddressGenerationClient neutron exception which
can occur when allocating a floating ip fails because
the pool has been exhausted. Convert the exception
to a nova NoMoreFloatingIps exception which will be handled
by the api layer and converted to a 404.

Change-Id: Ib5320a13b5cc0c493ef0763d0e2b4575dc699bdf
Partial-Bug: 1210598

commit_message:
Enhance rescope token test using v3

There was a problem in Keystone recently where revoking a token
derived from another token caused the original token to be
revoked, so adding a test here to validate it continues to work
as expected.

Change-Id: Ifd210e49c3e15721264eb47eed453889d4e35942

commit_message:
Use binding:vif_details to control firewall

Neutron can include 'ovs_hybrid_plug' and 'port_filter' boolean keys in
the binding:vif_details port attribute. 'port_filter' indicates whether
or not neutron is handling port filtering for nova to determine if it needs
to filter for that port. 'ovs_hybrid_plug' can be set to True to indicate
that the neutron plugin still requires the bridge plugging strategy to attach
firewall rules.

Corresponding neutron patch:
Review -  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/83280/
Commit -  8c42ba115b58cc2c7486be9fee89e1facedb5f76

Closes-Bug: 1297469
Change-Id: I3bbcfc67036ab7389c82720add0bc0fc627bfee0

subject: Add new style instance group scheduler filters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-27 21:55:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_filters.py', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/scheduler/filters/affinity_filter.py'], 'message': "Add new style instance group scheduler filters

Prior to Icehouse, there was a different type of handling of the
'group' scheduler hint that got lost in the completion of the server
groups API.  This patch completes the code necessary to provide
backwards compatibility with the old behavior.

Previously, the policy for groups was simply based on what scheduler
filters you had enabled.  You could have either the affinity or
anti-affinity filter enabled and that would be applied to all groups.
These filters now act on groups with a policy type of 'legacy'.

New filters have been added that can be enabled simultaneously and act
based on the policy set on the group via the server group API.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia65c151396415ca48725cb3c756f33efa01d2fe5
Closes-bug: #1296913
"}]
commit_message:
Add new style instance group scheduler filters

Prior to Icehouse, there was a different type of handling of the
'group' scheduler hint that got lost in the completion of the server
groups API.  This patch completes the code necessary to provide
backwards compatibility with the old behavior.

Previously, the policy for groups was simply based on what scheduler
filters you had enabled.  You could have either the affinity or
anti-affinity filter enabled and that would be applied to all groups.
These filters now act on groups with a policy type of 'legacy'.

New filters have been added that can be enabled simultaneously and act
based on the policy set on the group via the server group API.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia65c151396415ca48725cb3c756f33efa01d2fe5
Closes-bug: #1296913

commit_message:
improve performance of resource-list in sql

simplify the query to retrieve list of resources. it is much simpler
to query against raw Sample data then to join against Resource table.

also, add meter_links param to allow ability to disable link generation of
relate meters.

Change-Id: Ia4ceafc568c4a2e4c8e6b7586511135627b9335e
Closes-Bug: #1264434
Implements: blueprint big-data-sql

commit_message:
Remove unused hardcoded rpc_backend from template

Glance does not yet use the openstack common oslo.messaging layer
for notify.  This option is not needed anymore, it is derived
based upon notification_strategy setting.
Updated README to reflect this.

Related-Bug: 1257748
Change-Id: I9d7709655b9680e2f435b157245c2ed58a6fe32e

commit_message:
wip: DO NOT MERGE gather dstat data on ceilometer free env

just to get some additional baseline, would like to understand
what test runs look like without ceilometer to understand how it's
impacting other things in the system. Based on CERN comments that
ceilometer increased their nova api load by 16x.

Change-Id: I5ed589801c900dc97bb7c2d8c42b7461a3e076e0

commit_message:
Increase in the full path to mkfs.xfs(/sbin/mkfs.xfs).

Xfsprogs package has been installed. This is the cause of the error stack does not have
permission to perform mkfs.xfs command rather mkfs.xfs command in /sbin/
path, stack in order to perform mkfs.xfs must add the full path or use
the sudo command mode.

Fixed bug #1292466

Change-Id: I488133539331b4a0034a2afb4e75665904754245

subject: make the used index URL of pip install configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-28 11:28:10.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'make the used index URL of pip install configurable

To be able to use a custom PyPi mirror the index URL used by
pip install has to be configurable. This patch introduces the
parameter PIP_INDEX_URL. If this parameter is set the parameter
--index $PIP_INDEX_URL is used with pip install.

Change-Id: I7eb2cefe2cfede1f20894a58e01ac53c37a7e6c1
'}]
commit_message:
make the used index URL of pip install configurable

To be able to use a custom PyPi mirror the index URL used by
pip install has to be configurable. This patch introduces the
parameter PIP_INDEX_URL. If this parameter is set the parameter
--index $PIP_INDEX_URL is used with pip install.

Change-Id: I7eb2cefe2cfede1f20894a58e01ac53c37a7e6c1

commit_message:
Write out ring.gz's in a safer fashion

Write the ring file to a temporary location first and then move it into
place. This should help prevent issues like reading a partial ring file
while a new instances is being written out.

Change-Id: I28357a2f038a51cb9d823822b92f736dff033a9e

subject: Subscribe Neutron agent services to neutron.conf, update ChefSpec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-28 10:51:06.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/metadata_agent.rb', 'recipes/balancer.rb', 'spec/l3_agent_spec.rb', 'recipes/dhcp_agent.rb', 'Gemfile', 'recipes/linuxbridge.rb', 'recipes/openvswitch.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'spec/openvswitch_spec.rb', 'spec/balancer_spec.rb', 'spec/spec_helper.rb', 'Gemfile.lock', 'spec/linuxbridge_spec.rb', 'spec/metadata_agent_spec.rb', 'spec/dhcp_agent_spec.rb', 'recipes/l3_agent.rb'], 'message': 'Subscribe Neutron agent services to neutron.conf, update ChefSpec

Before this change, a change to neutron.conf would not cause any agent
to restart.  I doubt this was intended, since for example changing
rabbitmq stuff in neutron.conf really needs the agent to restart to have
any effect.

Furthermore, the balancer recipe subscription/notification logic has
been changed to fit in line with the other agents, i.e. having the ini
template notify the service and the service subscribe to neutron.conf.

To add proper tests for this behavior, ChefSpec was updated to 3.4.0.
In the process, the agent-related specs have been rounded off a little.

Change-Id: Iba3769fac378d964af232ce56be35582066a845f
'}]
commit_message:
Subscribe Neutron agent services to neutron.conf, update ChefSpec

Before this change, a change to neutron.conf would not cause any agent
to restart.  I doubt this was intended, since for example changing
rabbitmq stuff in neutron.conf really needs the agent to restart to have
any effect.

Furthermore, the balancer recipe subscription/notification logic has
been changed to fit in line with the other agents, i.e. having the ini
template notify the service and the service subscribe to neutron.conf.

To add proper tests for this behavior, ChefSpec was updated to 3.4.0.
In the process, the agent-related specs have been rounded off a little.

Change-Id: Iba3769fac378d964af232ce56be35582066a845f

commit_message:
Stop leaking in images tests

Resources created would not be cleanup if exception raised
in setUpClass. This patch use decorator 'safe_setup' to
cleanup those resources in images tests.

Partially Implements: blueprint stop-leaking

Change-Id: Ifbb534c008af0f6aca2a75d5c98d6e451a71eacd

subject: Fix seamicro validate() method definition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 21:51:35.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/seamicro.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_seamicro.py'], 'message': "Fix seamicro validate() method definition

The base class definition of vendor_passthru.validate() was changed
in 48a4223f so that it also required a 'task' parameter, but
the seamicro.vendor_passthru driver had not landed yet. Between that
change and the time the seamicro driver was landed, another change
caused us to stop running unit tests on third-party drivers.

So, we didn't notice that the seamicro.vendor_passthru.validate() method
definition was incompatibly broken.

Closes-bug: #1298648

Change-Id: I9eab4c1d1be0546a0cdbf40759e88bb22f5015d2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix seamicro validate() method definition

The base class definition of vendor_passthru.validate() was changed
in 48a4223f so that it also required a 'task' parameter, but
the seamicro.vendor_passthru driver had not landed yet. Between that
change and the time the seamicro driver was landed, another change
caused us to stop running unit tests on third-party drivers.

So, we didn't notice that the seamicro.vendor_passthru.validate() method
definition was incompatibly broken.

Closes-bug: #1298648

Change-Id: I9eab4c1d1be0546a0cdbf40759e88bb22f5015d2

subject: Python 3: cast map() result to list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-24 17:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_multithreading.py'], 'message': "Python 3: cast map() result to list

On Python 3, map() returns a generator, not a list. Cast explicitly the result
of map() to a list to get a list on Python 2 and Python 3.

The cast is useless in Python 2, but it doesn't hurt performances: it's just a
unit test.

Change-Id: I87486b7dbc42507a6fd7886748a2e09735b6fc5b
"}]
commit_message:
Python 3: cast map() result to list

On Python 3, map() returns a generator, not a list. Cast explicitly the result
of map() to a list to get a list on Python 2 and Python 3.

The cast is useless in Python 2, but it doesn't hurt performances: it's just a
unit test.

Change-Id: I87486b7dbc42507a6fd7886748a2e09735b6fc5b

subject: Fix race in worker-based executor result processing
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-28 07:06:58.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/executor.py'], 'message': 'Fix race in worker-based executor result processing

When worker-based engine receives event it should first remove
request from cache and then call request.set_result. Otherwise,
another thread waiting the request to complete might schedule
another request with same uuid (e.g. reversion of failed task),
which will replace current request in cache and then will
be deleted, thus leading to engine hang.

Related-bug: #1297668
Change-Id: Icbbca58067ee22fe45c63e1f69d189ea56697d20
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in worker-based executor result processing

When worker-based engine receives event it should first remove
request from cache and then call request.set_result. Otherwise,
another thread waiting the request to complete might schedule
another request with same uuid (e.g. reversion of failed task),
which will replace current request in cache and then will
be deleted, thus leading to engine hang.

Related-bug: #1297668
Change-Id: Icbbca58067ee22fe45c63e1f69d189ea56697d20

subject: Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7680, 'name': 'Alex Gaynor', 'email': 'alex.gaynor@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex_gaynor'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-27 11:21:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

dict.iteritems() has been removed in Python 3. In Python 2, dict.items()
creates a temporary list, but Samuel Merritt wrote:

"The size of the data is small enough that we don't need to worry about the
memory consumption; it's all just HTTP headers."

Change-Id: Iac427b8bbd032e4a1efb2bdc84a3968217eb6ddf
'}]
commit_message:
Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

dict.iteritems() has been removed in Python 3. In Python 2, dict.items()
creates a temporary list, but Samuel Merritt wrote:

"The size of the data is small enough that we don't need to worry about the
memory consumption; it's all just HTTP headers."

Change-Id: Iac427b8bbd032e4a1efb2bdc84a3968217eb6ddf

commit_message:
Fix bug ext2: parent directory not found with guestfs

When trying to work with guestfs an error:
  ext2: parent directory not found: /lib: File not found by ext2_lookup
To avoiding this error, after installing guestfs we have to use
the command 'sudo update-guestfs-appliance'

Change-Id: I3b0c702366739642ed61ac7ebc30a0911744a864
Closes-Bug: #1290798

commit_message:
Make index.rst usable

* Update to reflect new directory structure
* Drop maxdepth to 1, to make the page smaller, otherwise the index will
  include links to each section of each blueprint. And since each
  section will have the same name across bluepints this is useless.

Change-Id: I2a5d94ae26002a884033d27881394a795592fe3f

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-03-26 02:59:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Resize operation fails to change disk size

The finish_migration step will resize the cpu and memory to match
the new flavor chosen, but not the disk size.  Additional code was

Closes-bug: #1291741

commit_message:
VMware: Resize operation fails to change disk size

The finish_migration step will resize the cpu and memory to match
the new flavor chosen, but not the disk size.  Additional code was
added to extend the disk size using ExtendVirtualDisk_Task.

Change-Id: Iad9d023a67864cb720ddc84d7e155b991cbc7a19
Closes-bug: #1291741

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-28 00:57:43.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/json/hypervisor_client.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/hypervisors.py', 'tempest/services/compute/v3/json/hypervisor_client.py'], 'message': 'Verify hypervisor uptime attributes of Nova API

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
hypervisor uptime APIs ('os-hypervisors/<hyper_id>/uptime')
and validate the response with added JSON Schema to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 hypervisor uptime APIs is same
& given below:

{
    "hypervisor": {
        "id": %(hypervisor_id)s,
        "hypervisor_hostname": "fake-mini",
        "uptime": " 08:32:11 up 93 days, 18:25, 12 users,
                  load average: 0.20, 0.12, 0.14"
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I163c50e0ad277ef8ed639363d5e53f66e9f9d4e4
'}]
commit_message:
Verify hypervisor uptime attributes of Nova API

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
hypervisor uptime APIs ('os-hypervisors/<hyper_id>/uptime')
and validate the response with added JSON Schema to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 hypervisor uptime APIs is same
& given below:

{
    "hypervisor": {
        "id": %(hypervisor_id)s,
        "hypervisor_hostname": "fake-mini",
        "uptime": " 08:32:11 up 93 days, 18:25, 12 users,
                  load average: 0.20, 0.12, 0.14"
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I163c50e0ad277ef8ed639363d5e53f66e9f9d4e4

commit_message:
Ensure the swift ring is readable by swift.

Swift recently changed its ring writing logic such that the file mode
is user-only, breaking the previous a+r mode.

Change-Id: Ie0ef451f4bb19a7546039f1fae8bbd800e85087d

subject: Fix validation error for invalid field name in simple query
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-25 12:53:54.000000000', 'files': ['tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'tests/api/v2/test_list_meters_scenarios.py'], 'message': "Fix validation error for invalid field name in simple query

The field name validation code runs only in case of the operator that is
specified for the invalid field name, is 'eq'. Otherwise the validation
ends with an invalid operator error. The field name validation code was
modified to check the field name first and only checks the operators for
valid field names.

Closes-bug: #1294628

Change-Id: Id34ae882940b36dec3ea81043b0d29b996a38426
(cherry picked from commit 50cffbc08f24ff8e3935aabecdf4be0fb366116d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix validation error for invalid field name in simple query

The field name validation code runs only in case of the operator that is
specified for the invalid field name, is 'eq'. Otherwise the validation
ends with an invalid operator error. The field name validation code was
modified to check the field name first and only checks the operators for
valid field names.

Closes-bug: #1294628

Change-Id: Id34ae882940b36dec3ea81043b0d29b996a38426
(cherry picked from commit 50cffbc08f24ff8e3935aabecdf4be0fb366116d)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-28 03:47:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/images.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/images_client.py'], 'message': 'Verify the response status of create delete Image

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response status of Nova V2 Image
create, delete delete meta APIs and validate the response status with
added JSON Schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the
future.

create image, delete image & delete image meta does not return the
response body. Response status of above APIs is below-
create image - 202
delete image - 204
delete image meta - 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ia4864b3b7145a69dc257aba7f7612745b1b8254f
'}]
commit_message:
Verify the response status of create delete Image

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response status of Nova V2 Image
create, delete delete meta APIs and validate the response status with
added JSON Schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the
future.

create image, delete image & delete image meta does not return the
response body. Response status of above APIs is below-
create image - 202
delete image - 204
delete image meta - 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ia4864b3b7145a69dc257aba7f7612745b1b8254f

The best way to improve security throughout OpenStack is to be more aware

commit_message:
Adding section for security impact

The best way to improve security throughout OpenStack is to be more aware
of the security impact that design decisions have.  I think that adding a
section that focuses on security will help encourage people to think of this
during the design process.

This idea originated in an email thread on the openstack-security mailing
list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-security/2014-March/001351.html

Change-Id: I7945f7c99387aedabbce057130f3589831f77f1c

to design summit notes.

commit_message:
Update template to add references

Added a new section for reference, such as ML threads, or links
to design summit notes.

At the same time, ensuring authors take care that the document
is readable without access to any of the references.

Based on an idea suggested here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/81932

Change-Id: Ifcc69ffb4e9859ad3138b7e2acc716b97d232f39

commit_message:
Automatically create groups that do not exist

If the scheduler hint 'group' is specified and the contents are not a
UUID, automatically create the group.  This is to maintain backwards
compatibility with the old behavior of the 'group' scheduler hint.

The policy on this automatically created group is set as 'legacy'.
That way the scheduler knows that for this group it should emulate the
old group behavior for backwards compat purposes.

Partial-bug: #1296913

Change-Id: I0d4315980af7e47ae97dd4277784a74f086c8825

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-27 21:41:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance_group.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_instance_group.py'], 'message': "Add InstanceGroup.get_by_name()

Legacy behavior of the 'group' scheduler hint was that the value was
treated as a name for the group.  To preserve the old behavior, the
InstanceGroup object needs to be able to look up a group by name.

Since we're so close to doing an RC, just use the db API methods
available now but leave a note that this should be optimized later
with a db.api query that looks up the group by name.

Change-Id: I1b8c72b29a9a44a171aaa231aeb3533ccf41f7c2
Partial-bug: #1296913
"}]
commit_message:
Add InstanceGroup.get_by_name()

Legacy behavior of the 'group' scheduler hint was that the value was
treated as a name for the group.  To preserve the old behavior, the
InstanceGroup object needs to be able to look up a group by name.

Since we're so close to doing an RC, just use the db API methods
available now but leave a note that this should be optimized later
with a db.api query that looks up the group by name.

Change-Id: I1b8c72b29a9a44a171aaa231aeb3533ccf41f7c2
Partial-bug: #1296913

commit_message:
xen plugin change to handle old style images

Traverse the staging_path recursively for vhd files
to convert them to new style, after downloading
image in xen plugin.

There are some old style images which are downloaded as
folder with vhd files.

Fixes bug 1294587

commit_message:
Add cli client fro ostf adapter

Cli client for ostf adapter was added. Main features:
 * docopt module is using for command line arguments parsing
 * clint and blessings are using for advanced terminal output formatting
 * listing of available testsets and tests for given cluster are added
 * running of testrun for given cluster are added
 * stopping of running testrun are added via KeyboardInterrunpt handling

Not implemented but required features:
 * possibility to start particular tests for given testset
 * restarting action

Code is not working properly in all aspects so this work is in progress.

Change-Id: I382c67bf0e4552cbd227ecd30f8c64cecd32aebd
Implements: blueprint ostf-adapter-cli-client

Change-Id: I27a4c841b8f2c66e2b72ca406f354b02040d3510
Co-Authored-By: Jose Castro Leon <jose.castro.leon@cern.ch>
Closes-Bug: #1285065

commit_message:
LDAP global roles and group roles assignments

The list_role_assignments() function on LDAP assignment backend only
returns users roles assignments, not groups roles assignments.
Allowing to obtain group role assignments too, we can achieve that a
user can access to a project through a group.

Also, this patch allow to assign a role to a user without a tenant
(global role).

Change-Id: I27a4c841b8f2c66e2b72ca406f354b02040d3510
Co-Authored-By: Jose Castro Leon <jose.castro.leon@cern.ch>
Closes-Bug: #1285065
Closes-Bug: #1285136

commit_message:
Detecting unexpectedly not deleted resources

This is the initial part of handling the resource leakage issues.
This part aims to handle the tenant/project related resources,
but  not the possible 'tenant' leakage issue itself.

The leaked tenant in parallel run can be handled only at_axit or after
test suite finishes.

These cleanup oprtations acts before the tenant deletion.

TODO: Handle more resource resource type
TODO: Add the 'in tenant' resource handler to more test type
TODO: Collect and store all tenant creation for post cleanup
TODO: Use the same code with stress cleanup utility
Change-Id: I5dcacf4ff270a0d3ecbf5d628f0b62347344d09e

commit_message:

* Replace use of image id with name in all Nova tasks
* Support use of flavor name or id in NovaServers benchmark
* Replace use of flavor id with name in all Nova tasks

commit_message:
Compare metadata with database state

Using alembic internal api generate diff between
db state and metadata

There was bug with sqlalchemy reflection engine, that does not work
properly with UniqueConstraints.
It should fail with sqlalchemy<0.8.4, so we need to bump version.

subject: Fix FibreChannel detach devices key issue
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1313, 'name': 'yaguang', 'email': 'heut2008@gmail.com', 'username': 'heut2008'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-05 18:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py'], 'message': 'Fix FibreChannel detach devices key issue

This fixes the exception at detach time where the
devices key was missing from the connection_info.

This patch removes the reliance of the devices key
in the connection_info, which comes from the
block_device_mapping.  Unfortunately, nova has
many places where it calls the driver to attach
and detach LUNs from the system, and not all of those
places update/save the updated connection_info
in the block_device_mapping table.
A normal volume attach to a vm does update the
block_device_mapping table, so the devices key existed
at detach time.   A boot vm from volume does not update
the block_device_mapping after the attach call, so the
devices key was missing.

Change-Id: I83f9b7d22921caa048cf6d230e3e2c9267ce06b0
Closes-Bug: #1288360
'}]
commit_message:
Fix FibreChannel detach devices key issue

This fixes the exception at detach time where the
devices key was missing from the connection_info.

This patch removes the reliance of the devices key
in the connection_info, which comes from the
block_device_mapping.  Unfortunately, nova has
many places where it calls the driver to attach
and detach LUNs from the system, and not all of those
places update/save the updated connection_info
in the block_device_mapping table.
A normal volume attach to a vm does update the
block_device_mapping table, so the devices key existed
at detach time.   A boot vm from volume does not update
the block_device_mapping after the attach call, so the
devices key was missing.

Change-Id: I83f9b7d22921caa048cf6d230e3e2c9267ce06b0
Closes-Bug: #1288360

Extend, Attach, and Detach.

Change-Id: Idcab638a9ca30b87fdb70f7c571c22788b0d4c5d
Implements: blueprint add-flashsystem-svc
'}]
commit_message:
Adding FlashSystem 840 Cinder driver

This driver will currently support interfacing a single host direct
attached to an IBM FlashSystem 840 and fully supports Create, Delete,
Extend, Attach, and Detach.

Change-Id: Idcab638a9ca30b87fdb70f7c571c22788b0d4c5d
Implements: blueprint add-flashsystem-svc

revisions:

When getting statistics of a meter with invalid data string in query,

Closes-bug: #1270394
"}]
commit_message:
Show nvalid data string error info of statistics

When getting statistics of a meter with invalid data string in query,
the ceilometer CLI return 'HTTPInternalServerError', it should return the
details of the date string validation error.

Change-Id: I6e66c286b4b41a3ec05c61d046201b3b32614d94
Closes-bug: #1270394

subject: Trove Manual Installation guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-21 00:47:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/manual_install.rst', 'doc/source/dev/trove_manual_installation.rst'], 'message': 'Trove Manual Installation guide

Installation of Trove on a VM different from the controller node.
The openstack environment is Havana.
The Keystone service accepts only HTTPS connections.

According to the redstack script:
 - commands related to the datastore creation/configuration are updated.
 - details on the configuration files are provided.

	deleted:    trove_manual_installation.rst

Change-Id: I09b29354be0e0d4f1b7e629324eb43377eb1077f
'}]
commit_message:
Trove Manual Installation guide

Installation of Trove on a VM different from the controller node.
The openstack environment is Havana.
The Keystone service accepts only HTTPS connections.

According to the redstack script:
 - commands related to the datastore creation/configuration are updated.
 - details on the configuration files are provided.

	deleted:    trove_manual_installation.rst

Change-Id: I09b29354be0e0d4f1b7e629324eb43377eb1077f

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-10 06:29:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/quota_classes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Update quota-set throw 500 error

The server doesn't check whether the parameter "quota_set" or
"quota_class_set" is in request
body.So the 500 error has been thrown.

We should catch the KeyError and transfer the KeyError to
400(HTTPBadRequest) instead of 500.

Closes-Bug: #1249971
(cherry picked from commit 2ed2f3aff8eee70e02eb995780af292057cfcad4)
Change-Id: I01260c77efa50324f3d203888689cdb1e94d2c21

commit_message:
Update quota-set throw 500 error

The server doesn't check whether the parameter "quota_set" or
"quota_class_set" is in request
body.So the 500 error has been thrown.

We should catch the KeyError and transfer the KeyError to
400(HTTPBadRequest) instead of 500.

Closes-Bug: #1249971
(cherry picked from commit 2ed2f3aff8eee70e02eb995780af292057cfcad4)
Change-Id: I01260c77efa50324f3d203888689cdb1e94d2c21

commit_message:
NetApp fix for vsadmin role failure for ssc

The ssc feature does not work with vserver admin
role. If the user is a vsadmin then he does cannot
use the ssc feature fully. This fix checks the access
and issues apis appropriately and also handles error
conditions.

Closes-Bug: #1253657

Change-Id: Ibc4409e5d5e6e36bba41e5f59dd94c05b87b1cde
(cherry picked from commit 20667f7d49eed88ddd528be73293a624b3af1ba0)

commit_message:
Ensure the correct error message is displayed

When a untranslated error message pass through the translation pecan
hook, the previous translated error is send to the client.

This patch fix that by reseting the "translatable_error" of the
translation pecan hook before each request.

Conflicts:

    tests/api/v2/test_app.py

Change-Id: Icee79cf09fd696655048c7c0cf8a3d6706e31701
Fixes: bug #1260398
(cherry picked from commit 02d017022bab577b581b58f42b468bf0b2c644a9)

subject: VMware: Fixed upload-to-image for available volume
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-18 20:07:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/tests/test_vmware_vmdk.py'], 'message': "VMware: Fixed upload-to-image for available volume

Cinder generally does not allow upload-to-image operation on a volume
that is 'in-use'. This can however be over-ridden using the '--force True'
flag. The VMware driver cannot support upload-to-image when the volume is
in-use. This is a restriction for the VMware driver alone. When the user forces
an upload on a volume that is 'in-use' the Cinder api layer sets the volume
status to 'uploading' and calls into the driver code to upload. In this
scenario the VMware driver needs to fail the operation.

The current driver code here does this check wrongly by looking for volume
status of 'in-use'. Fixing this check to identify an in-use volume correctly.

Fixes bug: 1237338

(cherry picked from commit a2b774c0ce2a1aaa9cdfc7d7c4c4d642f1bfc3d1)

Change-Id: If54edfdc242a7a1bff442b6bb4c5a9865eede1dc
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fixed upload-to-image for available volume

Cinder generally does not allow upload-to-image operation on a volume
that is 'in-use'. This can however be over-ridden using the '--force True'
flag. The VMware driver cannot support upload-to-image when the volume is
in-use. This is a restriction for the VMware driver alone. When the user forces
an upload on a volume that is 'in-use' the Cinder api layer sets the volume
status to 'uploading' and calls into the driver code to upload. In this
scenario the VMware driver needs to fail the operation.

The current driver code here does this check wrongly by looking for volume
status of 'in-use'. Fixing this check to identify an in-use volume correctly.

Fixes bug: 1237338

(cherry picked from commit a2b774c0ce2a1aaa9cdfc7d7c4c4d642f1bfc3d1)

Change-Id: If54edfdc242a7a1bff442b6bb4c5a9865eede1dc

glance requires pyOpenSSL>=0.11

are new in pyOpenSSL 0.11. Global requirements already fixed, do the
same change in glance

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 23:15:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/models_v2.py'], 'message': "Subnets should be set as lazy='join'

Currently if one does a net-list tons of queries are issued against the
database as the default query mode is 'select' which performs a query when
the field is actually accessed. In this patch I change the the mode to
'joined' so subnets are loaded as the networks are loaded. Usually, there
are only 1 or 2 subnets on a network so loading this data shouldn't hurt.
This patch in my setup with 5000 networks reduces the net-list call from 27
seconds to 7! Woot Woot :)

Change-Id: I10eec4d79b522dfd685d3d2aa93a8d643104bba7
Closes-bug: 1298053
(cherry picked from commit cbeda85fe5284d2ec0ba39976cdf6ffcdfbdd84a)
"}]
commit_message:
Subnets should be set as lazy='join'

Currently if one does a net-list tons of queries are issued against the
database as the default query mode is 'select' which performs a query when
the field is actually accessed. In this patch I change the the mode to
'joined' so subnets are loaded as the networks are loaded. Usually, there
are only 1 or 2 subnets on a network so loading this data shouldn't hurt.
This patch in my setup with 5000 networks reduces the net-list call from 27
seconds to 7! Woot Woot :)

Change-Id: I10eec4d79b522dfd685d3d2aa93a8d643104bba7
Closes-bug: 1298053
(cherry picked from commit cbeda85fe5284d2ec0ba39976cdf6ffcdfbdd84a)

commit_message:
Fix issue deleting ec2-credentials as non-admin user

The ec2tokens controller incorrectly uses the access id, not the
hashed credential id in _assert_owner, which means that non-admin
users can't delete their ec2-credentials.  Adding the hashing, as
in _get_credentials fixes the problem.  Test added demonstrating
the issue.

Change-Id: Ifb6e3e10a50541cf21d25880bd74e9aeb6df4f26
Closes-Bug: #1245435
(cherry picked from commit 85ca6ac8a7fab14c659673ddf47777badcbcbf04)

commit_message:
Pass thru credentials to allow re-authentication

This is a backport of 4 fixes squashed into one because:

1. They need to all be merged together as they build on each
   other as problems were found in each change after it was
   merged on master.
2. The 3rd change won't pass Jenkins on it's own so it has
   to be squashed with the 4th and final change, so I'm just
   going to squash the entire topic branch together.

The change bugs fixed and cherry pick commit hashes are left
intact for each change.

Closes-Bug: #1241275
(cherry picked from commit 51e5f52e4cb60e266ccde71f205c91eb8c97b48b)

Cache Neutron Client for Admin Scenarios

Closes-Bug: #1250580
(cherry picked from commit 85332012dede96fa6729026c2a90594ea0502ac5)

Users with admin role in Nova should not re-auth with Neutron

Closes-Bug: 1250763
(cherry picked from commit 1c1371c78b990447aeaa4377b512f8887e6ff3ce)

Fix Neutron Authentication for Metadata Service

Closes-Bug:  1255577
(cherry picked from commit 652620d12f3afe6845e41d9762b52d23f44fd557)

============

Change-Id: I2858562b180f3e058a2da9d67bef02af80927177

Reduce number of novaclient calls

Currently, each client creates a new session for
each call. This fix makes novaclient re-use
sessions in the most obvoius cases.

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-27 19:35:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/043_migrate_template_versions.py'], 'message': 'Migrate invalid template version values

If a stack was created with a template that specified an invalid time,
a variety of operations cannot be done on the stack, resulting in a
general breakage of Heat.  This patch migrates any occurances of version
numbers that are invalid that were specified prior to the merging of this
patch.  This patch also handles invalid version fields where a non-date
is specified or an invalid date was specified.

Change-Id: I5387ffb84dba5160103b3cb02f3d1cc5f352ff29
Closes-bug: 1296859
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate invalid template version values

If a stack was created with a template that specified an invalid time,
a variety of operations cannot be done on the stack, resulting in a
general breakage of Heat.  This patch migrates any occurances of version
numbers that are invalid that were specified prior to the merging of this
patch.  This patch also handles invalid version fields where a non-date
is specified or an invalid date was specified.

Change-Id: I5387ffb84dba5160103b3cb02f3d1cc5f352ff29
Closes-bug: 1296859

commit_message:
Use AccessInfo in auth_token middleware

auth_token middleware parses the token and extracts the data manually.
We have this parsing ability in AccessInfo now so we should use that
instead.

Change-Id: I23c6e33d327c3d3669fb977d9623b788324c4785

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Fix deadlock in volume clone

The create_cloned_volume path could deadlock due to
create_cloned_volume and create/delete_snapshot using the same
lock for synchronization.

Refactor the calls to create/delete snapshot to call the inner
method which does not use a lock.

Introduced by "06999f6 GlusterFS: Synchronize additional op..."

Related-Bug: 1267983
Closes-Bug: 1272092

(cherry picked from commit e9722f09dfd4b58e40afbf285ab9a7738a641dca)

Note: Effectively includes most changes from "8772714 Pylint fixes ..."
to resolve conflicts.
(cherry picked from commit 8772714b4fcb2d05ae7f0bfe5cfd0fa660ab9100)

Conflicts:
        cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py

Change-Id: I84ca34b201c10644faa047f1c9274c14bcdd0359

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 18:04:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'GlusterFS: Synchronize additional operations

create_cloned_volume() and copy_volume_to_image() should also be
locked against other driver operations to prevent collisions
from concurrent updates of snapshot metadata or volume file data.

Closes-Bug: #1267983

(cherry picked from commit 06999f610afc3a123f7a54895e39d690301a8eba)

'}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: Synchronize additional operations

create_cloned_volume() and copy_volume_to_image() should also be
locked against other driver operations to prevent collisions
from concurrent updates of snapshot metadata or volume file data.

Closes-Bug: #1267983

(cherry picked from commit 06999f610afc3a123f7a54895e39d690301a8eba)

Change-Id: Idd6158bfbe4dc049c33fa58b40d3d570fc244d01

commit_message:
Use CMS to generate sample tokens

This is preparing for compressed tokens.  We don't want anything in the
keystone server tree that assumes it knows the formats of the token.
This uses the CMS code to preduce the sample data.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-25 15:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developing.rst', '.testr.conf'], 'message': 'Allows override of stdout/stderr/log capturing

During a test run stdout, stderr and log messages are being captured. If
the test fails all three will be printed out so that can be inspected.
Each stream has an environment variable that can be used to stop it from
being printed at the end of a test run by setting its value to 0. This
is in line with what many of the other project are already doing.

Environment variables:

 - OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE for stdout
 - OS_STDERR_CAPTURE for stderr
 - OS_LOG_CAPTURE for logging

Change-Id: I2fed99069950b839e060297026c8e06cbd45bb98
'}]
commit_message:
Allows override of stdout/stderr/log capturing

During a test run stdout, stderr and log messages are being captured. If
the test fails all three will be printed out so that can be inspected.
Each stream has an environment variable that can be used to stop it from
being printed at the end of a test run by setting its value to 0. This
is in line with what many of the other project are already doing.

Environment variables:

 - OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE for stdout
 - OS_STDERR_CAPTURE for stderr
 - OS_LOG_CAPTURE for logging

Change-Id: I2fed99069950b839e060297026c8e06cbd45bb98

commit_message:
Start using to oslotest

oslotest provides a BaseTestCase class then enables proper capturing of
stdout, stderr and logging streams during a test run. We will take
advantage of this capability in the near future.

Change-Id: I16761053f631e709224eee813dc0f423f06c8870

commit_message:
Remove the update default quotas feature

The default quota panel has been moved to a tab in the system
info panel.
The update default quotas feature has been removed.
The cinder quota-class methods have been removed to keep consistency.
The test cases and the apis for nova and cinder have been modified
according the change.

This change is done to support the change:
I1110022d6f628d03aaf363da707f2d2ef1600437

Change-Id: I193c7209d9681b6d69afe0d996153ac86850d243
Closes-Bug: #1292589

subject: Check create/delete keypair attribute of Nova APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-24 10:35:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/v3/json/keypairs_client.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/keypairs.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v3/keypairs.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/keypairs.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/keypairs_client.py'], 'message': 'Check create/delete keypair attribute of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
create & delete keypair APIs and validate the response with
added JSON Schema to block the backward incompatibility change
in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 create_keypairs APIs is same and
given below:

{
    "keypair": {
        "fingerprint": "%(fingerprint)s",
        "name": "%(keypair_name)s",
        "public_key": "%(public_key)s",
        "user_id": "fake",
        "private_key": "%(private_key)s"
    }
}

Response status code differ for create and delete keypairs

V2 - create_keypair = 200
V2 - delete_keypair = 202
V3 - create_keypair = 201
V3 - delete_keypair = 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I179f0f11a43324d81ecbb41c0eae2f7072e8979a
'}]
commit_message:
Check create/delete keypair attribute of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
create & delete keypair APIs and validate the response with
added JSON Schema to block the backward incompatibility change
in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 create_keypairs APIs is same and
given below:

{
    "keypair": {
        "fingerprint": "%(fingerprint)s",
        "name": "%(keypair_name)s",
        "public_key": "%(public_key)s",
        "user_id": "fake",
        "private_key": "%(private_key)s"
    }
}

Response status code differ for create and delete keypairs

V2 - create_keypair = 200
V2 - delete_keypair = 202
V3 - create_keypair = 201
V3 - delete_keypair = 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I179f0f11a43324d81ecbb41c0eae2f7072e8979a

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-21 15:58:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_host_api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_services.py', 'nova/compute/cells_api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_services.py'], 'message': 'Fix service API and cells

The move to the object model broke the service API when used together
with cells. The underlying problem is how cells will overload the id
field with a cell path to uniquely identify each service in each cell.

Changing the id to a string would defeat the purpose of the object model
so this patch uses a proxy to modify the id on access to make the
difference transparent to the API.

Change-Id: I165b5d64b0c1556511eb02d179ca9fc6f101c008
Closes-bug: 1251043
'}]
commit_message:
Fix service API and cells

The move to the object model broke the service API when used together
with cells. The underlying problem is how cells will overload the id
field with a cell path to uniquely identify each service in each cell.

Changing the id to a string would defeat the purpose of the object model
so this patch uses a proxy to modify the id on access to make the
difference transparent to the API.

Change-Id: I165b5d64b0c1556511eb02d179ca9fc6f101c008
Closes-bug: 1251043

commit_message:
Fix volume transfer href issue

The volume transfer collection in url defined as "os-volume-tranfer",
but I got another define "tranfers" in href url. They are different.
So it should be modify.

Change-Id: I69a43012f2bb70ce5fc7b0331d2759527a261170

commit_message:
Add Ironic support to incubator.

This patch:

 - adds metadata for Ironic to testenv's.
 - adds a variable (USE_IRONIC) which controls whether to use Ironic
   or Nova-BM in baremetal clouds.
 - implements cloud bringup logic for Ironic.

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Haynes <greg@greghaynes.net>
Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ib80fa745ccd9ef54e7582d8e86fdbc49230ee616

Add get_vm_storage_paths function to vmutilsv2.py

get_vm_storage_paths implementation on Hyper-V V2 API changed
compared to previous V1 API. In previous V1 APIs, using
Msvm_ResourceAllocationSettingData class can get storage
paths, but in V2 API, only using Msvm_StorageAllocationSettingData
class can get the storage paths.

(cherry-picked from commit 6847a0ef927929e631e9c6db2e2812528ca93151)

Closes-Bug: #1248463

Change-Id: I9821ae49d8d88345e83d7dcda22c28b87cf17e23

commit_message:
Fixes get_vm_storage_paths issue for Hyper-V V2 API

Add get_vm_storage_paths function to vmutilsv2.py

get_vm_storage_paths implementation on Hyper-V V2 API changed
compared to previous V1 API. In previous V1 APIs, using
Msvm_ResourceAllocationSettingData class can get storage
paths, but in V2 API, only using Msvm_StorageAllocationSettingData
class can get the storage paths.

(cherry-picked from commit 6847a0ef927929e631e9c6db2e2812528ca93151)

Closes-Bug: #1248463

Change-Id: I9821ae49d8d88345e83d7dcda22c28b87cf17e23

commit_message:
Update documentation for HDS HUS cinder driver

This change propose an update in HUS documentation.
  - remove unused information
  - adds more details about the configuration of HUS volumes
  - rename driver files: as we there are new HDS drivers in the road, we
    rename the driver to avoid confusions

Change-Id: I0030b115d921f228881d3ce529d590f25f79f20a
Implements: blueprint hds-hus-update

commit_message:
Big Switch Plugin: No REST port delete on net del

Moves the REST call for port deletion out of the
_delete_port method into the delete_port method
so it doesn't get called during a delete_network
operation. The backend controller automatically
removes ports that are a member of a network when
it's deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1295438
Change-Id: Ic09eb722f8e9bd3ce298dee90d8415cda1a1aa7a

commit_message:
Sanitize node.last_error message strings

Instead of exposing driver's exception messages in the REST API
via the node.last_error property, this patch simplifies the error
message strings while still logging the full exception for the admin.

This patch also cleans up a few related LOG messages.

Change-Id: I9a8d1f2539123f5c3d1f6bfac1d590cc75e90729
Closes-bug: 1265587

subject: Refactor LDAP API
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-27 14:40:17.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_ldap_livetest.py', 'keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'Refactor LDAP API

The fake LDAP API must emulate the python-ldap API as much as possible
otherwise much of the LDAP testing is invalid. The python-ldap API
only accepts utf-8 encoded strings. However, the fake LDAP API accepts
any Python type therefore properly handling type conversion into and
out of the LDAP API is not exercised by the fake LDAP API during
testing. Currently type conversion is done inside the LdapWrapper
which calls the python-ldap API, this means unicode issues only appear
when testing with a live LDAP server.

LdapWrapper and FakeLdap logically are two different providers of the
same API, as such they should behave identically. Which LDAP API is
used at run time a configurable option.

We need a mechanism by which we can substitute an LDAP API and then
wrap the calls to that API with type conversions. Type conversion
wrapping replaces the Python types used in Keystone with the types
needed for the LDAP API, calls the LDAP API, and then type converts
the results back from LDAP to those used by Keystone.

This patch establishes an LDAP API interface (LDAPHandler), modifies
fake LDAP to support it, replaces LdapWrapper with the interface
(invoking python-ldap) and adds another LDAPHandler instance which
will be the common location for type conversions prior to calling the
configured LDAP interface. See the LDAPHandler class definition for
details).

This patch is exclusively a refactoring patch anticipating a
subsequent patch to properly handle unicode values. There is no
significant change in functionality with this patch, it is just
refactoring to more cleanly seperate API boundaries. A few tests which
exercised unicode were disabled in this patch because they will not
work until the next patch which adds back in correct unicode
handling. The idea here is to separate out the refactoring needed to
support unicode from the actual unicode changes, this should make
reviewing easier.

Partial-Bug: 1172106
Change-Id: I7db24040689245a616332b08744f40ab8381579d
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor LDAP API

The fake LDAP API must emulate the python-ldap API as much as possible
otherwise much of the LDAP testing is invalid. The python-ldap API
only accepts utf-8 encoded strings. However, the fake LDAP API accepts
any Python type therefore properly handling type conversion into and
out of the LDAP API is not exercised by the fake LDAP API during
testing. Currently type conversion is done inside the LdapWrapper
which calls the python-ldap API, this means unicode issues only appear
when testing with a live LDAP server.

LdapWrapper and FakeLdap logically are two different providers of the
same API, as such they should behave identically. Which LDAP API is
used at run time a configurable option.

We need a mechanism by which we can substitute an LDAP API and then
wrap the calls to that API with type conversions. Type conversion
wrapping replaces the Python types used in Keystone with the types
needed for the LDAP API, calls the LDAP API, and then type converts
the results back from LDAP to those used by Keystone.

This patch establishes an LDAP API interface (LDAPHandler), modifies
fake LDAP to support it, replaces LdapWrapper with the interface
(invoking python-ldap) and adds another LDAPHandler instance which
will be the common location for type conversions prior to calling the
configured LDAP interface. See the LDAPHandler class definition for
details).

This patch is exclusively a refactoring patch anticipating a
subsequent patch to properly handle unicode values. There is no
significant change in functionality with this patch, it is just
refactoring to more cleanly seperate API boundaries. A few tests which
exercised unicode were disabled in this patch because they will not
work until the next patch which adds back in correct unicode
handling. The idea here is to separate out the refactoring needed to
support unicode from the actual unicode changes, this should make
reviewing easier.

Partial-Bug: 1172106
Change-Id: I7db24040689245a616332b08744f40ab8381579d

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-03-14 10:37:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/middleware/auth_token.py', 'ironic/common/exception.py', 'ironic/api/hooks.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_acl.py'], 'message': "Process public API list as regular expressions

In order to allow flexible patterns for public API specification
and to speed up the process of checking whether some request is
performed against the public API, it's reasonable to interpret the
list of public endpoints as regular expressions.

This patch changes the logic of checking whether a request requires
authorisation from searching the endpoint in the set to checking the
endpoint against a list of regular expressions.

Closes-bug: #1251880
Change-Id: I638ca0e20fa7e44fbeeae0d1e4c2f4188fb597a5
"}]
commit_message:
Process public API list as regular expressions

In order to allow flexible patterns for public API specification
and to speed up the process of checking whether some request is
performed against the public API, it's reasonable to interpret the
list of public endpoints as regular expressions.

This patch changes the logic of checking whether a request requires
authorisation from searching the endpoint in the set to checking the
endpoint against a list of regular expressions.

Closes-bug: #1251880
Change-Id: I638ca0e20fa7e44fbeeae0d1e4c2f4188fb597a5

Adding stop base broke the partial-ncpu upgrade test. The correct fix is

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE

Adding stop base broke the partial-ncpu upgrade test. The correct fix is
to make devstack  support stopping nova_rest and nova_compute, just like
start does. But until those patches land, this patch is to make sure
nova will actually pass the partial ncpu job.

Change-Id: I5e38bc801280bf0a283cecda013aa4f101099b2d

commit_message:
Raise unexpected exceptions during destroy()

Do not match exception by __name__ When an API request throws an
unexpected exception.  Avoids nova-compute AttributeError traceback
and provides better debug info on the nova side.

Change-Id: I2886df814e8641717c57f77626f92917d1ff744c
Closes-bug: #1297549

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9787, 'name': 'Big Switch CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@bigswitch.com', 'username': 'bsn', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9925, 'name': 'Midokura CI', 'username': 'midokura', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10117, 'name': 'PLUMgrid CI', 'email': 'plumgrid-ci-os@plumgrid.com', 'username': 'plumgrid-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10192, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'cisco-openstack-neutron-ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_neutron_ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-25 11:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': "Use a more accurate max_delay for reconnects

In an HA deployment, a 60 seconds delay between reconnects can be quite
problematic. This patch changes the delay calculation by setting the max
delay to 5s and by changing the way it is increased.

Unfortunately, this is one of the places where both our main drivers are
not consistent. Rabbit's driver uses configuration parameters for this
whereas qpid's driver has never had one. However, I would prefer not
adding configuration paremeters to qpid's driver for the following
reasons:

    1. Most of OpenStack services depend on the messaging layer, hence
    they need it to be available. A 5s delay seems to be reasonable and
    I could argue the need of tune it further. Although so frequent
    reconnects can add load to the network, that wouldn't be the main
    issue if one of the brokers go down.
    2. We're trying to move away from configuration options towards using
    transport URL. This path is still not clear and I would
    prefer avoiding adding new options until we clear it out.

(the patch is synced from oslo-incubator)

Change-Id: I537015f452eb770acba41fdedfe221628f52a920
Closes-bug: #1281148
"}]
commit_message:
Use a more accurate max_delay for reconnects

In an HA deployment, a 60 seconds delay between reconnects can be quite
problematic. This patch changes the delay calculation by setting the max
delay to 5s and by changing the way it is increased.

Unfortunately, this is one of the places where both our main drivers are
not consistent. Rabbit's driver uses configuration parameters for this
whereas qpid's driver has never had one. However, I would prefer not
adding configuration paremeters to qpid's driver for the following
reasons:

    1. Most of OpenStack services depend on the messaging layer, hence
    they need it to be available. A 5s delay seems to be reasonable and
    I could argue the need of tune it further. Although so frequent
    reconnects can add load to the network, that wouldn't be the main
    issue if one of the brokers go down.
    2. We're trying to move away from configuration options towards using
    transport URL. This path is still not clear and I would
    prefer avoiding adding new options until we clear it out.

(the patch is synced from oslo-incubator)

Change-Id: I537015f452eb770acba41fdedfe221628f52a920
Closes-bug: #1281148

commit_message:
Disable volume attach/detach for suspended instances

As described in the bug - some hypervisors (libvirt) do not support
this. It is best to disable it in the API to provide a consistent user
experience.

Also adds a test to prevent an accidental regression.

Change-Id: I5b404cca22cffecbaf524e2511810e5341242052
Closes-bug: #1240922

subject: Prevent cross plugging router ports from other tenants
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9787, 'name': 'Big Switch CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@bigswitch.com', 'username': 'bsn', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9925, 'name': 'Midokura CI', 'username': 'midokura', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10116, 'name': 'NEC CI', 'email': 'nec-openstack-ci@iaas.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'nec-openstack-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10117, 'name': 'PLUMgrid CI', 'email': 'plumgrid-ci-os@plumgrid.com', 'username': 'plumgrid-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10184, 'name': 'Nuage CI', 'email': 'nuage-ci@nuagenetworks.net', 'username': 'nuage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10192, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'cisco-openstack-neutron-ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_neutron_ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10294, 'name': 'Brocade VDX CI', 'email': 'openstack_gerrit@brocade.com', 'username': 'bci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 14:19:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Prevent cross plugging router ports from other tenants

Previously, a tenant could plug an interface into another tenant's
router if he knew their router_id by creating a port with the correct
device_id and device_owner. This patch prevents this from occuring
by preventing non-admin users from creating ports with device_owner
network:router_interface with a device_id that matches another tenants router.
In addition, it prevents one from updating a ports device_owner and device_id
so that the device_id won't match another tenants router with device_owner
being network:router_interface.

NOTE: with this change it does open up the possiblity for a tenant to discover
router_id's of another tenant's by guessing them and updating a port till
a conflict occurs. That said, randomly guessing the router id would be hard
and in theory should not matter if exposed. We also need to allow a tenant
to update the device_id on network:router_interface ports as this would be
used for by anyone using a vm as a service router. This issue will be fixed in
another patch upstream as a db migration is required but since this needs
to be backported to all stable branches this is not possible.

NOTE: The only plugins affect by this are the ones that use the l3-agent.

NOTE: **One should perform and audit of the ports that are already
        attached to routers after applying this patch and remove ports
        that a tenant may have cross plugged.**

Change-Id: I8bc6241f537d937e5729072dcc76871bf407cdb3
Closes-bug: #1243327
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent cross plugging router ports from other tenants

Previously, a tenant could plug an interface into another tenant's
router if he knew their router_id by creating a port with the correct
device_id and device_owner. This patch prevents this from occuring
by preventing non-admin users from creating ports with device_owner
network:router_interface with a device_id that matches another tenants router.
In addition, it prevents one from updating a ports device_owner and device_id
so that the device_id won't match another tenants router with device_owner
being network:router_interface.

NOTE: with this change it does open up the possiblity for a tenant to discover
router_id's of another tenant's by guessing them and updating a port till
a conflict occurs. That said, randomly guessing the router id would be hard
and in theory should not matter if exposed. We also need to allow a tenant
to update the device_id on network:router_interface ports as this would be
used for by anyone using a vm as a service router. This issue will be fixed in
another patch upstream as a db migration is required but since this needs
to be backported to all stable branches this is not possible.

NOTE: The only plugins affect by this are the ones that use the l3-agent.

NOTE: **One should perform and audit of the ports that are already
        attached to routers after applying this patch and remove ports
        that a tenant may have cross plugged.**

Change-Id: I8bc6241f537d937e5729072dcc76871bf407cdb3
Closes-bug: #1243327

commit_message:
Use testr directly in tempest verifier

Script `run_tempest.sh` writes needed records into environment and
parses arguments for transmission them to testr.
It is difficult to control arguments which passed into testr by
this script. Therefore, it would be nice if rally will use testr directly.

Blueprint tempest-verification
Closes-Bug: #1297328

Change-Id: Ia06334b1d150f2ac12720d4d238e98c922ed20f0

commit_message:
Accept accept 'timeout' in FakeMemcache.set()

tests.api.v2:FakeMemcache.set() should accept 'timeout' instead of
'time' since Keystoneclient's auth_token middleware only uses 'time'
when for it's own memcache client.

Related to bug 1095730
Fixes bug 1251644

Change-Id: Ic0ab81e1db7423851bd73e56cb3a0eed962eb708

router if he knew their router_id by creating a port with the correct

by preventing non-admin users from creating ports with device_owner
network:router_interface with a device_id that matches another tenants router.
In addition, it prevents one from updating a ports device_owner and device_id
so that the device_id won't match another tenants router with device_owner
being network:router_interface.

NOTE: with this change it does open up the possiblity for a tenant to discover
router_id's of another tenant's by guessing them and updating a port till
a conflict occurs. That said, randomly guessing the router id would be hard
and in theory should not matter if exposed. We also need to allow a tenant
to update the device_id on network:router_interface ports as this would be
used for by anyone using a vm as a service router. This issue will be fixed in
another patch upstream as a db migration is required but since this needs
to be backported to all stable branches this is not possible.

NOTE: The only plugins affect by this are the ones that use the l3-agent.

NOTE: **One should perform and audit of the ports that are already
attached to routers after applying this patch and remove ports
that a tenant may have cross plugged.**

Closes-bug: #1243327

Conflicts:
   quantum/common/exceptions.py
   quantum/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py
   quantum/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py

Change-Id: I8bc6241f537d937e5729072dcc76871bf407cdb3
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent cross plugging router ports from other tenants

Previously, a tenant could plug an interface into another tenant's
router if he knew their router_id by creating a port with the correct
device_id and device_owner. This patch prevents this from occuring
by preventing non-admin users from creating ports with device_owner
network:router_interface with a device_id that matches another tenants router.
In addition, it prevents one from updating a ports device_owner and device_id
so that the device_id won't match another tenants router with device_owner
being network:router_interface.

NOTE: with this change it does open up the possiblity for a tenant to discover
router_id's of another tenant's by guessing them and updating a port till
a conflict occurs. That said, randomly guessing the router id would be hard
and in theory should not matter if exposed. We also need to allow a tenant
to update the device_id on network:router_interface ports as this would be
used for by anyone using a vm as a service router. This issue will be fixed in
another patch upstream as a db migration is required but since this needs
to be backported to all stable branches this is not possible.

NOTE: The only plugins affect by this are the ones that use the l3-agent.

NOTE: **One should perform and audit of the ports that are already
attached to routers after applying this patch and remove ports
that a tenant may have cross plugged.**

Closes-bug: #1243327

Conflicts:
   quantum/common/exceptions.py
   quantum/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py
   quantum/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py

Change-Id: I8bc6241f537d937e5729072dcc76871bf407cdb3

subject: Install tgt package for cinder package install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 19:38:05.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/install.d/cinder-package-install/72-cinder'], 'message': "Install tgt package for cinder package install

The package install of cinder no longer always requires tgt (depends on
the distro). In some cases, the distro may prefer LIO instead. However,
the cinder package install should work with the upstream default of tgt,
so explicitly install tgt to make sure it's installed.

Change-Id: Ibe4ae0caf1ddf0ed4d27e715329471ab68a37b28
"}]
commit_message:
Install tgt package for cinder package install

The package install of cinder no longer always requires tgt (depends on
the distro). In some cases, the distro may prefer LIO instead. However,
the cinder package install should work with the upstream default of tgt,
so explicitly install tgt to make sure it's installed.

Change-Id: Ibe4ae0caf1ddf0ed4d27e715329471ab68a37b28

commit_message:
Add pm_type to the nodes list.

Ironic, unlike Nova-BM supports different power managers per node.

In order to configure nodes we thus need to know the desired power
manager.

This is separate to the main Ironic support patch in that it has to be
deployed on the testenv machines for CI to be able to consume it.

Change-Id: Ie4c91e039f6788b2a92909b0e0a9e540e092283c

subject: Fixes Hyper-V Inspector disk metrics bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-26 10:18:06.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/hyperv/utilsv2.py'], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V Inspector disk metrics bug

Changed disk metric names used by Hyper-V utils.

Was using wrong metric names before. 'Aggregated Disk Data Read/Written'
metrics refers to all disks (sum), while the metrics needs to be per disk.

(cherry picked from commit 39c0ca654743513ab158fac399813a1a557ab61e)

Change-Id: I4ec36152a8b8147069151dd6eb98f36f7aab9229
Closes-Bug: 1250336
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V Inspector disk metrics bug

Changed disk metric names used by Hyper-V utils.

Was using wrong metric names before. 'Aggregated Disk Data Read/Written'
metrics refers to all disks (sum), while the metrics needs to be per disk.

(cherry picked from commit 39c0ca654743513ab158fac399813a1a557ab61e)

Change-Id: I4ec36152a8b8147069151dd6eb98f36f7aab9229
Closes-Bug: 1250336

This corresponds to do API calls on:

Usage:
aggregates = [{'func': 'cardinality', 'param': 'resource_id'}])

commit_message:
Implementation of statistics aggregators

This corresponds to do API calls on:
/v2/meters/meter-name/statistics?aggregate.func=func-name

Usage:
aggregates = [{'func': 'cardinality', 'param': 'resource_id'}])
client.statistics.list(meter_name="instance", aggregates=aggregates)

CLI:
ceilometer statistics -m instance -a "cardinality<-resource_id"

Change-Id: I0096668585a5c7e7985973f07049eb91f44413fe

subject: 4.1.1 Remove instance power-off in delete function
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-26 15:07:58.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/nmanager.py'], 'message': '4.1.1 Remove instance power-off in delete function

In case if instance deleteion fails we try
to reset instance state, nova power-off action
was invokes, that leads to the raise of
UnexpectedTaskStateError_Remote

In this patch invocation of power-off was deleted
Now, we do several retries for deleteion and
if instance fails to be deleted - fail the test

Change-Id: Ic059d976a6a312fa32a90fa24b439e133031780e
Closes-bug: #1285094
'}]
commit_message:
4.1.1 Remove instance power-off in delete function

In case if instance deleteion fails we try
to reset instance state, nova power-off action
was invokes, that leads to the raise of
UnexpectedTaskStateError_Remote

In this patch invocation of power-off was deleted
Now, we do several retries for deleteion and
if instance fails to be deleted - fail the test

Change-Id: Ic059d976a6a312fa32a90fa24b439e133031780e
Closes-bug: #1285094

commit_message:
4.1.1 Add deletion of floating ip

First problem - we have 2 very simmilar tests
that differs only by 1 step. In this patch
this 2 tests merge into 1.

Second one - during the tests we do not release
floating ip, we just disassociate it,
and release only in teardown(
when all tests from suite were executed).To fix this issue
add floating ip deleteion as a separate step

Change-Id: I5cc0a782cdc5914e250ae5176aa8a724b797a934
Closes-bug: #1288547

commit_message:
Add valid check and unit tests on quota class

1.Cinder quota class hard_limit’s value should larger than -1 (-1 is a flag
value for unlimited).
2.Add unit tests for quota class.
3.Add quota_classes extension enabled in unitest, so as to do
unitest for quota_classes' update operation.

Closes-bug: #1245360

Change-Id: Ie483db1bdbd4fac875de26abab8ebebd96f4938b
(cherry picked from commit 8b6d51ea04a65d846b0e92a11e191327360d7427)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 07:11:58.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Glance image-list failed when image number exceed DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE

The root cause of the problem is that DB2 does not allow
an empty string ('') for datetime field. So we set the
default value of datetime as None.

Fixes bug 1245947

Change-Id: Ie372efe70a068024298fbde4574e33e565cc6c9a
(cherry picked from commit 3f533a28fa79e5ad7d2703123565f34839cd9ff3)
"}]
commit_message:
Glance image-list failed when image number exceed DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE

The root cause of the problem is that DB2 does not allow
an empty string ('') for datetime field. So we set the
default value of datetime as None.

Fixes bug 1245947

Change-Id: Ie372efe70a068024298fbde4574e33e565cc6c9a
(cherry picked from commit 3f533a28fa79e5ad7d2703123565f34839cd9ff3)
