subject: Avoid incomplete running
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-15 02:19:32.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py'], 'message': 'Avoid incomplete running

In the cases where schedule() fails (or other calls in the main
schedule loop) we should not abort running which will leave
a bunch of tasks running (but never completed) but instead we
should attempt to try to finish as many as we can.

Such failures can be caused by storage failures for example.

Change-Id: I8ee49950c86f4bed7298870f7631611ba05b1de5
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid incomplete running

In the cases where schedule() fails (or other calls in the main
schedule loop) we should not abort running which will leave
a bunch of tasks running (but never completed) but instead we
should attempt to try to finish as many as we can.

Such failures can be caused by storage failures for example.

Change-Id: I8ee49950c86f4bed7298870f7631611ba05b1de5

commit_message:
WIP: add v2.1 plugins tree

This patch add entry point and plugins for v2.1

In this patch, V2.1 controller is based on v3 controller. This
way can handle more sophisticated way. If we want change the action name,
return code or more sophisticated thing, we can override the method.

This patch use migrate_live as example. And it also need translate
the request body(https://review.openstack.org/#/dashboard/6167).
But for the POC, just route to the action is enough.

Change-Id: I51f46fa9b961c7c4a0f3004924507a4138534005

commit_message:
Fix null value of 'updated_at' on update response

Updated time is null value in response body while updating
"availability_zone" for aggregate only.

The patch will get 'created_at' value from the 'aggregate_metadata'table
while updating "availability_zone" first time. And get the 'updated_at'
value from the 'aggregate_metadata' table for after updating.

Change-Id: Ib89d73ab390f4440b5673518b3ee106e8eec79b2
Closes-Bug: #1254980

commit_message:
Determine schema location properly even with symlinks

If etc/ is a symlink, abspath() traverses back into the wrong
directory tree. Use normpath() instead.

Change-Id: Iee9baa7c7290b5a2eb2ded8cd5fb9cd93062ef4b

commit_message:
Fix import log_handler error with publish_errors set

Sync from Olso.
Commit Id is Ibf28ba17f81b5ddeda653f6a3501ecac18ffcd42

This handler sends all error logs as rpc notifications.
Note: when using publish_errors you also need to set the
notification_driver option too.

Closes-bug: #1240349
Change-Id: Ie66b23af8da2e439e0ac2f5677f6a064e3dd3133
(cherry picked from commit 932d3549910a8d8dba4620e5b5371c56faea9032)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-26 14:12:39.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/servers.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Enhance the nova boot --nic option. A new argument vnic-type is introduced.

  --nic <net-id=net-uuid,v4-fixed-ip=ip-addr,port-id=port-uuid>,vnic-type=vnic-type
                        Create a NIC on the server. Specify option multiple
                        times to create multiple NICs. net-id: attach NIC to
                        network with this UUID (required if no port-id), v4
                        -fixed-ip: IPv4 fixed address for NIC (optional),
                        port-id: attach NIC to port with this UUID (required
                        if no net-id), vnic-type: optional vnic type (normal,
                        macvtap or direct, default to normal)

Change-Id: I70176620414d5a73a04b8ac45ef192651c993f50
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance the nova boot --nic option. A new argument vnic-type is introduced.

  --nic <net-id=net-uuid,v4-fixed-ip=ip-addr,port-id=port-uuid>,vnic-type=vnic-type
                        Create a NIC on the server. Specify option multiple
                        times to create multiple NICs. net-id: attach NIC to
                        network with this UUID (required if no port-id), v4
                        -fixed-ip: IPv4 fixed address for NIC (optional),
                        port-id: attach NIC to port with this UUID (required
                        if no net-id), vnic-type: optional vnic type (normal,
                        macvtap or direct, default to normal)

Change-Id: I70176620414d5a73a04b8ac45ef192651c993f50
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

subject: fixes for glance-swift user to be created when swift is enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-17 23:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['files/keystone_data.sh'], 'message': 'fixes for glance-swift user to be created when swift is enabled

user glance-swift was not created regardless service swift or
s-proxy is enabled. This causes devstack to fail when swift is
enabled. This fix will correct that problem.

Change-Id: Idd70cb55a7b438ea227fdca2fa4337d4ca594fe6
fixes: bug#1276029
'}]
commit_message:
fixes for glance-swift user to be created when swift is enabled

user glance-swift was not created regardless service swift or
s-proxy is enabled. This causes devstack to fail when swift is
enabled. This fix will correct that problem.

Change-Id: Idd70cb55a7b438ea227fdca2fa4337d4ca594fe6

commit_message:
Add Action List Tab to Environments

This patch adds a new tab to the Environment page.
On this tab a list of available actions for each application
and nested objects will be displayed.
The list has a tree like structure with foldable entries.

Change-Id: I738cf9a2dd1982a0b0d8a43fdc448554ca7d46bb
Partly-Implements: blueprint ui-application-event-list

commit_message:
Use service catalog to get glance client for nova

Now nova get glance client according to the configuration
'glance_api_servers' in nova.conf. If we didn't configure
glance host or glance_api_servers, nova may not get the
right glance client.

This commit allows nova to create glance client without
endpoint, then glance client will get the endpoint url
by service catalog.

This commit depends on another commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/67383/

Change-Id: Iecb25cbf23fb4f3cdaf67f58564a81a1d3fce14f
Closes-Bug: #1220131

commit_message:
Fix pre-created ports in neutron from being deleted by nova

Previously, nova would delete all of the ports on an instance when
the instance was deleted. Though it should only delete the ports that
it had allocated. For example, ports explicitly passed in via
--nic port-id=<> should not be delete.

This patch add `nova_no_clean` tag into binding profile, iff the tag
exists and is set True, the port won't be deleted when deleting vm or
detaching the interface.

Change-Id: I44d1d6e351601192147b393af974fd2675b36810
Closes-bug: #1158684

subject: libvirt: Fix issue injecting an empty admin password
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-11 12:22:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Fix issue injecting an empty admin password

There are a number of implicit tests for None of a singleton object in
driver._inject_data() which create potential problems. At the very
least, they prevent the injection of an empty admin password, as
bool('') is False.

This change creates an inject dict which is populated only with data
to be injected. Values to be added are tested explicitly for equality
to None, fixing the admin password injection problem. The length of
the dict is trivially tested for data to be injected.

A test for injection of an empty admin password is added.

The dict can also used directly to pass data to disk.inject_data by
name, removing a potentially fragile long list of function arguments
which must all be ordered correctly. This requires a mechanical change
to all the existing mock argument tests.

Lastly, the target partition is only calculated if there is data to be
injected.

Change-Id: Ib650c9b212ca6ed537096f85cb331ae899a46cd5
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix issue injecting an empty admin password

There are a number of implicit tests for None of a singleton object in
driver._inject_data() which create potential problems. At the very
least, they prevent the injection of an empty admin password, as
bool('') is False.

This change creates an inject dict which is populated only with data
to be injected. Values to be added are tested explicitly for equality
to None, fixing the admin password injection problem. The length of
the dict is trivially tested for data to be injected.

A test for injection of an empty admin password is added.

The dict can also used directly to pass data to disk.inject_data by
name, removing a potentially fragile long list of function arguments
which must all be ordered correctly. This requires a mechanical change
to all the existing mock argument tests.

Lastly, the target partition is only calculated if there is data to be
injected.

Change-Id: Ib650c9b212ca6ed537096f85cb331ae899a46cd5

commit_message:
Trove Manual Installation guide

Installation of Trove on a VM different from the controller node.
The openstack environment is Havana.
The Keystone service accepts only HTTPS connections.

According to the redstack script:
 - commands related to the datastore creation/configuration are updated.
 - details on the configuration files are provided.

Change-Id: If5b19e92a1ca045bb07d84c657b99e84a78e2940

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-11 12:22:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/test_virt_disk.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': "disk/api.py: Fix bug injecting empty but non-None values

A missing 'is not None' means empty but non-None values couldn't be
injected into a guest. For example, it was not possible to inject an
empty admin password.

test_inject_admin_password() is modified for re-use. Also some trivial code
cleanup:

* Updated to use mock
* Removal of unnecessary string concatenations
* Add comment explaining generation of magic test strings

Change-Id: I338fb63348327f488dfefac9dcb2a41a4a424066
"}]
commit_message:
disk/api.py: Fix bug injecting empty but non-None values

A missing 'is not None' means empty but non-None values couldn't be
injected into a guest. For example, it was not possible to inject an
empty admin password.

test_inject_admin_password() is modified for re-use. Also some trivial code
cleanup:

* Updated to use mock
* Removal of unnecessary string concatenations
* Add comment explaining generation of magic test strings

Change-Id: I338fb63348327f488dfefac9dcb2a41a4a424066

Implement meter query by 'counter_volume' field

Support query 'counter_volume' field with comparison operators:[ge,
gt, le, lt].

It is implemented in sqlalchemy,mongodb and db2 driver.

Closes-Bug: #1202569

commit_message:
Add options for some commands executing run_vsctl

All commands executing 'run_vsctl' should appropriately raise the
RuntimeError if operating add/set commands and should avoid
raising the RuntimeError if operating get db commands.

* Add 'check_error=True' option for vsctl cammands to add/set values
* Add '--if-exist' option for vsctl cammands to get value without unwanted
Exception
* Modify and complement unit tests

Change-Id: Ia72e744f51d2a371a0503275d9b33a9aa3656189
Closes-Bug: #1255879

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-20 00:37:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmware_images.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Use the image virtual size when available

Glance is now able to store the virtual size of a disk (using the
v2 api), This property is accessible from the v1 api and is read-only.
This virtual size can be leveraged in case a of sparse or
stream-optimized disk where the image size is usually less
than the actual disk size.

This patch addresses the issue by using the virtual size when available
in the image metadata.

Change-Id: I2c215d30ac320cbbdc944c8600f2a0d5119ce279
Closes-Bug: #1240373
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Use the image virtual size when available

Glance is now able to store the virtual size of a disk (using the
v2 api), This property is accessible from the v1 api and is read-only.
This virtual size can be leveraged in case a of sparse or
stream-optimized disk where the image size is usually less
than the actual disk size.

This patch addresses the issue by using the virtual size when available
in the image metadata.

Change-Id: I2c215d30ac320cbbdc944c8600f2a0d5119ce279
Closes-Bug: #1240373

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent quota usage for security group

The quota usage for security group do not decrease when the security
group is deleted by admin. Fixes the issue by using the new quotas
object.

Change-Id: If82ee4edeca934c7be360e4129baa12b1c9a4da1
Closes-bug: 1260575

subject: NetApp cmode nfs: Fix QOS extra spec
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-27 02:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/ssc_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/nfs.py'], 'message': 'NetApp cmode nfs: Fix QOS extra spec

This patch fixes the incorrect behavior where the NetApp cmode
nfs driver will choose to create a volume on a flexVol that has
a QOS policy group that matches the specified QOS policy group
intended for the cinder volume. The correct behavior is to ignore
the QOS policy group of the flexVol and instead assign the QOS policy
group to the newly created cinder volume.

Change-Id: I45d905da2a9a07b3ae8c00a225ab3b7f7ceb12d8
Closes-Bug: #1288283
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp cmode nfs: Fix QOS extra spec

This patch fixes the incorrect behavior where the NetApp cmode
nfs driver will choose to create a volume on a flexVol that has
a QOS policy group that matches the specified QOS policy group
intended for the cinder volume. The correct behavior is to ignore
the QOS policy group of the flexVol and instead assign the QOS policy
group to the newly created cinder volume.

Change-Id: I45d905da2a9a07b3ae8c00a225ab3b7f7ceb12d8
Closes-Bug: #1288283

subject: Fixes a problem in attach volume in EMC driver.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-03-26 22:56:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_smis_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_emc_smis.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_smis_common.py'], 'message': "Fixes a problem in attach volume in EMC driver.

This patch fixes a problem in attach volume in EMC SMI-S driver.
The existing logic checks if a volume is already attached to any host,
but it doesn't check whether a volume is already attached to the specific
host that nova wants cinder to attach.  As a result, initialize_connection
could return success (thinking it is already attached), but nova will
fail to discover the LUN later and fail the attach.

This patch adds a check to see if a volume is already attached to a
specific host.  If not, it will do the attach.  The reason that the
volume being attached already could be due to a nova live-migration
use case.  Cinder doesn't support multiple attaches currently, but
allows a volume to be attached multiple times from nova during
live-migration.

Change-Id: I05a2f57cd8708d7fcbe902ec13665a9cfb44db07
Closes-Bug: #1295906
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes a problem in attach volume in EMC driver.

This patch fixes a problem in attach volume in EMC SMI-S driver.
The existing logic checks if a volume is already attached to any host,
but it doesn't check whether a volume is already attached to the specific
host that nova wants cinder to attach.  As a result, initialize_connection
could return success (thinking it is already attached), but nova will
fail to discover the LUN later and fail the attach.

This patch adds a check to see if a volume is already attached to a
specific host.  If not, it will do the attach.  The reason that the
volume being attached already could be due to a nova live-migration
use case.  Cinder doesn't support multiple attaches currently, but
allows a volume to be attached multiple times from nova during
live-migration.

Change-Id: I05a2f57cd8708d7fcbe902ec13665a9cfb44db07
Closes-Bug: #1295906

commit_message:
Changes to correct name of missing NetApp license.

Change to have the NetApp ZAPI error of "SIS clone not licensed"
refer to the correct NetApp license of "FlexClone not licensed".
This code path is encountered when the NetApp 7mode driver uses
the clone interface for snapshotting or cloning.

Change-Id: I3e4d07d38870928a324ad044e03938826b0d0a98
Closes-Bug: #1295349

commit_message:
Pass the mirrorlog option as two arguments.

We don't use shell=True when we Popen, so we have to keep all
arguments as separate values.

Change-Id: Ic35fad36be72386d3496920e259c32fe16625046

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-26 20:57:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/models_v2.py'], 'message': "Subnets should be set as lazy='join'

Currently if one does a net-list tons of queries are issued against the
database as the default query mode is 'select' which performs a query when
the field is actually accessed. In this patch I change the the mode to
'joined' so subnets are loaded as the networks are loaded. Usually, there
are only 1 or 2 subnets on a network so loading this data shouldn't hurt.
This patch in my setup with 5000 networks reduces the net-list call from 27
seconds to 7! Woot Woot :)

Change-Id: I10eec4d79b522dfd685d3d2aa93a8d643104bba7
Closes-bug: 1298053
"}]
commit_message:
Subnets should be set as lazy='join'

Currently if one does a net-list tons of queries are issued against the
database as the default query mode is 'select' which performs a query when
the field is actually accessed. In this patch I change the the mode to
'joined' so subnets are loaded as the networks are loaded. Usually, there
are only 1 or 2 subnets on a network so loading this data shouldn't hurt.
This patch in my setup with 5000 networks reduces the net-list call from 27
seconds to 7! Woot Woot :)

Change-Id: I10eec4d79b522dfd685d3d2aa93a8d643104bba7
Closes-bug: 1298053

Change-Id: Iedf2d15b1ad98050913730cdd703720c09ebd339
'}]
commit_message:
Add --quiet option to neutron-ha-tool

To disable all logging except for warnings in errors. Increase log level of
"router needs migration" message from info to warning and also use logging for
printing exceptions in __main__.

Change-Id: Iedf2d15b1ad98050913730cdd703720c09ebd339

commit_message:
enable a single worker by default

there are issues with postgresql and multiple connections. change
default to a single worker to still allow multiple workers for
backends which support it.

Partial-Bug: #1298073
Change-Id: I1bf256f333ad8614bcae2c74dc0544553bffbbe7

commit_message:
Get rid of XML related trove client bindings

We will no longer support XML for the trove API; it behooves us to
remove XML related code, and clean up the trove client.

Partially implements bp: destroy-xml-api
Change-Id: I58f95e81f3e4bc4bad277ff2a48abfced2b48199

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-25 23:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/fakeldap.py'], 'message': "code hygiene; use six.text_type, escape regexp's, use key function

Some simple code clean up for code hygiene

Need to use unicode() rather than str() to properly handle non-ascii
characters, but to be PY2/PY3 compatible use six.text_type.

Regexp's were formed by string formatting using run-time substitutions
but the substitutions were not escaped. If the substituion contained
regexp metachars the regexp could fail.

The db key was formed by string substituion but this code was
duplicated in many places, introduce a method, key() to eliminate the
code duplication. At the same time introduce the dn() method to
transform the dn to an internal format. Currently the dn() method is a
place holder whose implementation will be added in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I1fbb8cf420606c77b1eed346376050f21790a8e1
"}]
commit_message:
code hygiene; use six.text_type, escape regexp's, use key function

Some simple code clean up for code hygiene

Need to use unicode() rather than str() to properly handle non-ascii
characters, but to be PY2/PY3 compatible use six.text_type.

Regexp's were formed by string formatting using run-time substitutions
but the substitutions were not escaped. If the substituion contained
regexp metachars the regexp could fail.

The db key was formed by string substituion but this code was
duplicated in many places, introduce a method, key() to eliminate the
code duplication. At the same time introduce the dn() method to
transform the dn to an internal format. Currently the dn() method is a
place holder whose implementation will be added in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I1fbb8cf420606c77b1eed346376050f21790a8e1

commit_message:
Update config generator from OSLO

Cinders sample config is out of date with recent
updates needed for keystone, however we had an
old version of the oslo generator so there was
no way to pick these changes up locally by running
the generate tool.

This pulls the latest generator.py from oslo, and
we run the update script to get us back in sync.

Current head of oslo:

  Merge: 2b08343 0dbcae1
  Author: Jenkins <jenkins@review.openstack.org>

six.moves.builtins instead.

commit_message:
Temporary fix for config file generation

Generation of the config file in the gate has been broken by the fix for
bug 1262148, Ia6a3d82d19b7d239ffc0b42a47e1ce7383f10564, becoming available
in a release of the oslo.config library.

This patch modifies the config file generator to work around the bug. Note
that this has *not* been submitted upstream to oslo-incubator, and
therefore would not normally be allowed. In this case it may be justified
to unblock the gate.

Related-bug: #1288586

Change-Id: If380ae5e6ff3908240790df1139adae47d059b80

To start to begin the process of simplifying flows
we can start this by adding a graph property onto
each pattern that came be the graph that is used in
flattening (eventually we can remove flows and just

Change-Id: Ia7088bf8dbe778f9feac17a7bada94766840e827
'}]
commit_message:
Add graph property to all flow patterns

To start to begin the process of simplifying flows
we can start this by adding a graph property onto
each pattern that came be the graph that is used in
flattening (eventually we can remove flows and just
use the graph_flow pattern if we want). Have an adjusted
flattener use this new graph property to reduce the
amount of custom flattening logic required to reduce
flows and nested flows into a execution graph.

Change-Id: Ia7088bf8dbe778f9feac17a7bada94766840e827

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-26 06:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/__init__.py'], 'message': 'share neutron admin auth tokens

Admin tokens in nova.network.neutronv2 were being created once per
"thread" (i.e., green thread) and shared. For example, during instance
creation, a single token was created then reused 6 times.  However,
this scheme was far from optimal. Given that tokens, by default, have
a shelf life of 24H, a single token can be shared by _all_ admin
nova.network.neutronv2 calls in a 24-hour period.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Peter Feiner <peter@gridcentric.ca>
Closes-Bug: 1255594

Change-Id: Ief9b56c69cc894be07fbbe497319ca4b4f6ab142
'}]
commit_message:
share neutron admin auth tokens

Admin tokens in nova.network.neutronv2 were being created once per
"thread" (i.e., green thread) and shared. For example, during instance
creation, a single token was created then reused 6 times.  However,
this scheme was far from optimal. Given that tokens, by default, have
a shelf life of 24H, a single token can be shared by _all_ admin
nova.network.neutronv2 calls in a 24-hour period.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Peter Feiner <peter@gridcentric.ca>
Closes-Bug: 1255594

Change-Id: Ief9b56c69cc894be07fbbe497319ca4b4f6ab142

commit_message:

But, some part of swiftclient test were written with invalid order.
This patch fixes this problem.

commit_message:
debian: install cloud-init on Wheezy

cloud-init packages are not available in the Debian Wheezy repository.
However, they are available in wheezy-backports.

With this change, the cloud-init packages are installed from
wheezy-backports if DIB_RELEASE is wheezy.

Change-Id: I3daa3b0ba185ba3f7c1bf6b8f9b1f8c167fcb340

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 8617, 'name': 'Hunter Haugen', 'email': 'hunter@puppet.com', 'username': 'hunner'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-21 00:33:52.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ceilometer_db_spec.rb', 'manifests/db.pp'], 'message': 'Retry ceilometer-dbsync on failure

Some database services do not accept connections immediately
(cough*mongodb*cough) but take several seconds to finish initializing.
This commit will cause the ceilometer-dbsync to retry on failure in the
hopes that it is only a transient error.

Change-Id: I57d42fed5f2359011747bb764424383e05ad7ee1
'}]
commit_message:
Retry ceilometer-dbsync on failure

Some database services do not accept connections immediately
(cough*mongodb*cough) but take several seconds to finish initializing.
This commit will cause the ceilometer-dbsync to retry on failure in the
hopes that it is only a transient error.

Change-Id: I57d42fed5f2359011747bb764424383e05ad7ee1

commit_message:

The way that arrays were built-up for multi-line items caused the arrays
to become more tested with each element, making structures like
[[[a, b], c], d]

This corrects the behavior

subject: Move change state to after storage calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-14 18:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py'], 'message': 'Move change state to after storage calls

Instead of changing the state before we call
into storage, change it to after we get the
needed values from storage, this way if storage
fails (or has issues) the state will be left
unchanged.

This makes the storage calls preconditions for
a change state to occur (which seems to make
sense).

Change-Id: I78e107d6098b06fb42244ebfef1e5214746dc7fc
'}]
commit_message:
Move change state to after storage calls

Instead of changing the state before we call
into storage, change it to after we get the
needed values from storage, this way if storage
fails (or has issues) the state will be left
unchanged.

This makes the storage calls preconditions for
a change state to occur (which seems to make
sense).

Change-Id: I78e107d6098b06fb42244ebfef1e5214746dc7fc

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-26 16:04:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance_group.py'], 'message': 'postgres incompatibility in InstanceGroup.get_hosts()

The original code fails in postgresql with:

"No operator matches the given name and argument type(s).
You might need to add explicit type casts."

It looks like the problem is that postgres doesn't do
implicit casts, so I changed the code to check a different column
that didn't require any.

Change-Id: I9342ec2bfbdd991d5f7a238eca59af003c7e7eac
Closes-bug: 1292963
'}]
commit_message:
postgres incompatibility in InstanceGroup.get_hosts()

The original code fails in postgresql with:

"No operator matches the given name and argument type(s).
You might need to add explicit type casts."

It looks like the problem is that postgres doesn't do
implicit casts, so I changed the code to check a different column
that didn't require any.

Change-Id: I9342ec2bfbdd991d5f7a238eca59af003c7e7eac
Closes-bug: 1292963

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-26 15:29:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add missing test for None in sqlalchemy query filter

In sqlalchemy a comparison against a non-null value will not match
null values, so the existing code at the end of
db.sqlalchemy.api.instance_get_all_by_filters() will not return
instances where vm_state is NULL.

This would be fine if the vm_state could never be null, but it
is declared as "nullable" in the Instance object. In many cases
"vm_state" will in fact have a value, but not all--in
get_test_instance() in test/utils.py the value of "vm_state" is not
specified.  There may be other similar cases.

Accordingly, this commit updates the test to explicitly check for None.

Without this fix the unit tests for bug 1292963 will fail because
the test instances have a vm_state of None.

Closes-Bug: 1294756
Related-Bug: 1292963
Change-Id: I271cff22dec160fd0e76abadefd0fe06d32c3227
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing test for None in sqlalchemy query filter

In sqlalchemy a comparison against a non-null value will not match
null values, so the existing code at the end of
db.sqlalchemy.api.instance_get_all_by_filters() will not return
instances where vm_state is NULL.

This would be fine if the vm_state could never be null, but it
is declared as "nullable" in the Instance object. In many cases
"vm_state" will in fact have a value, but not all--in
get_test_instance() in test/utils.py the value of "vm_state" is not
specified.  There may be other similar cases.

Accordingly, this commit updates the test to explicitly check for None.

Without this fix the unit tests for bug 1292963 will fail because
the test instances have a vm_state of None.

Closes-Bug: 1294756
Related-Bug: 1292963
Change-Id: I271cff22dec160fd0e76abadefd0fe06d32c3227

commit_message:
Remove pip version specifier

We don't actually require pip 1.4, and saying that we do
breaks package installation in a lot of cases. Remove the
version specifier from our requirements list.

Fixes-bug: #1296310
Change-Id: I69c67c4c8cba7076e33292eaab9070ba51b4dff3

subject: Update tox.ini so flake8 works even without hacking
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-04 16:29:53.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update tox.ini so flake8 works even without hacking

The flake8 command (when run from the command line or via vim-flake8) seems to
bypass the the normal pep8 [W]arning and [E]rror as well as py[F]lake checks
if the project level tox.ini includes a select, but doesn't include them in
it's select option (tested on flake8 v2.0 and v2.1).  Somehow if hacking is
installed these checks always run even if they're not explicitly listed in the
select list - but adding them so flake8 works on our project even without
hacking doesn't seem to cause any problems.

Also The [flake8] section's "select" option in tox.ini doesn't seem to run all
checks when presented with the space-comma seperated list.  I had to pull out
the bare except check (H201), because our hacking fix for the "H201 # noqa"
hasn't been released to pypi yet (maybe hacking version 0.9.0?).

As far as I know the Swift core development team is fully onboard with pep8,
and the flake8 checks are mostly like "unused import" stuff - so I *think*
this change is more about making the tool test what we want it too and not
changing or adding any new requirements or expectations.

Change-Id: Ia911c63745100cce182d5c5eb67b77e31c1e9b18
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini so flake8 works even without hacking

The flake8 command (when run from the command line or via vim-flake8) seems to
bypass the the normal pep8 [W]arning and [E]rror as well as py[F]lake checks
if the project level tox.ini includes a select, but doesn't include them in
it's select option (tested on flake8 v2.0 and v2.1).  Somehow if hacking is
installed these checks always run even if they're not explicitly listed in the
select list - but adding them so flake8 works on our project even without
hacking doesn't seem to cause any problems.

Also The [flake8] section's "select" option in tox.ini doesn't seem to run all
checks when presented with the space-comma seperated list.  I had to pull out
the bare except check (H201), because our hacking fix for the "H201 # noqa"
hasn't been released to pypi yet (maybe hacking version 0.9.0?).

As far as I know the Swift core development team is fully onboard with pep8,
and the flake8 checks are mostly like "unused import" stuff - so I *think*
this change is more about making the tool test what we want it too and not
changing or adding any new requirements or expectations.

Change-Id: Ia911c63745100cce182d5c5eb67b77e31c1e9b18

commit_message:
Support binding:vif_security parameter in neutron

Configure filtering rule based on port binding configration
in neturon. nova can say to libvirt which type of spoofing (ip, mac,
dhcp) should be used.

Fixes creation of qbr bridge and veth pairs on neutron demands by
passing require_iptables.

Change-Id: I704a49cebe3153d070a3d39c9ad090f04472753a
Closes-Bug: #1112912

commit_message:
Remove test for obsolated port_filter on Neutron

Neutron security group is broken now. In order to fix it,
Neutron must send vif plugging related parameters to nova.
However exisiting port_filter attribute is insufficient for this
purpose, so we need to obsolate port_filter attribute.
(See discussion in the related bug #1112912)
This is a patch for Neturon
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21946/
This is a patch for Nova
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44596/

In this commit, we need to remove tempest test for
obsolated port_filter attribute.

Change-Id: I66c6ab991624989d3213dbda17a90fa6da85e5b1
Related-bug: #1112912

commit_message:
Fix spurious warning in pipeline check

The storage::server class includes a bit of logic that checks
the pipeline and warns if ${type}-server isn't included.
However, the check has a logic flaw such that if $pipeline is an
array and contains ${type}-server, the warning is triggered
anyway.  This patch corrects the bad logic so that the warning
isn't triggered spuriously.

Change-Id: I7f81598f2f7910a2175fe772c9d82b2a1067826c
Closes-Bug: #1289187

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2014-03-26 18:34:00.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/backend.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'swift/container/updater.py', 'test/unit/account/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'swift/account/utils.py', 'swift/account/server.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'etc/swift.conf-sample', 'test/unit/account/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'Add Storage Policy Support to Account HEAD

This change updates the account HEAD handler to report out per
policy object and byte usage for the account.  Cumulative values
are still reported and policy names are used in the report
out (unless request is sent to an account server directly in
which case policy indexes are used for easier accounting).

Below is an example of the relevant HEAD response for a cluster
with 3 policies and just a few small objects:

   X-Account-Container-Count: 3
   X-Account-Object-Count: 3
   X-Account-Bytes-Used: 21
   X-Storage-Policy-Bronze-Object-Count: 1
   X-Storage-Policy-Bronze-Bytes-Used: 7
   X-Storage-Policy-Silver-Object-Count: 1
   X-Storage-Policy-Silver-Bytes-Used: 7
   X-Storage-Policy-Gold-Object-Count: 1
   X-Storage-Policy-Gold-Bytes-Used: 7

Change-Id: I5ec251f9a8014dd89764340de927d09466c72221
Implements: blueprint storage-policies
'}]
commit_message:
Add Storage Policy Support to Account HEAD

This change updates the account HEAD handler to report out per
policy object and byte usage for the account.  Cumulative values
are still reported and policy names are used in the report
out (unless request is sent to an account server directly in
which case policy indexes are used for easier accounting).

Below is an example of the relevant HEAD response for a cluster
with 3 policies and just a few small objects:

   X-Account-Container-Count: 3
   X-Account-Object-Count: 3
   X-Account-Bytes-Used: 21
   X-Storage-Policy-Bronze-Object-Count: 1
   X-Storage-Policy-Bronze-Bytes-Used: 7
   X-Storage-Policy-Silver-Object-Count: 1
   X-Storage-Policy-Silver-Bytes-Used: 7
   X-Storage-Policy-Gold-Object-Count: 1
   X-Storage-Policy-Gold-Bytes-Used: 7

Change-Id: I5ec251f9a8014dd89764340de927d09466c72221
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

subject: Provide a new ComputeManager for Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-03-26 18:39:59.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/nova/compute/__init__.py', 'ironic/nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Provide a new ComputeManager for Ironic

Ironic is internally clustered and that causes some friction
with Nova which assumes that each n-cpu instance is the only
one responsible for any given VM. While this is going to be
addressed in the long term, at the moment we need to make
it possible to run in an HA setup for Ironic.

The short term solution proposed is to run 2+ nova-compute's
each of which reports the same hostname (e.g. ironic). This
works but has some caveats - one of which is that _init_instance
will now race between different nova-compute instances starting
up at the same time. A custom ComputeManager permits us to address
that without prejuidice to future long term solutions.

Relatedly, TripleO needs Ironic to permit service startup before
keystone is initialised, which the removal of API calls during
init_host permits - and as there are no API calls needed for
correct behaviour of the Ironic driver, this is straight forward :).

See https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-nova-friction for
more discussion.

Change-Id: I68d46c4da8715df03c3a88393b55665dc57045a3
Closes-Bug: #1295503
"}]
commit_message:
Provide a new ComputeManager for Ironic

Ironic is internally clustered and that causes some friction
with Nova which assumes that each n-cpu instance is the only
one responsible for any given VM. While this is going to be
addressed in the long term, at the moment we need to make
it possible to run in an HA setup for Ironic.

The short term solution proposed is to run 2+ nova-compute's
each of which reports the same hostname (e.g. ironic). This
works but has some caveats - one of which is that _init_instance
will now race between different nova-compute instances starting
up at the same time. A custom ComputeManager permits us to address
that without prejuidice to future long term solutions.

Relatedly, TripleO needs Ironic to permit service startup before
keystone is initialised, which the removal of API calls during
init_host permits - and as there are no API calls needed for
correct behaviour of the Ironic driver, this is straight forward :).

See https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-nova-friction for
more discussion.

Change-Id: I68d46c4da8715df03c3a88393b55665dc57045a3
Closes-Bug: #1295503

subject: Bump up sleep when expecting a timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-26 00:35:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Bump up sleep when expecting a timeout

It seemed like some of the tests ment to exercise the proxy's timeout could
would occastionally race and the backend mock would be able to cough up a
chunk before the timeout fired in the proxy - typically resulting in a failed
assertion like " lalala" != 'lalala'.

We paramaterize the timeout value, and bump it up for those cases where we are
expecting to hit the timeout.  Timing shows this change is just as fast for
passing tests.  And if you want to break the node_timeout in
proxy.controller.base you can verify the tests are still just as effective -
if a bit slower to detect the failure path.

Fixes bug #1272509

Change-Id: Iaf91d9d551e94fc317a08e8c0ee02daeed331b60
'}]
commit_message:
Bump up sleep when expecting a timeout

It seemed like some of the tests ment to exercise the proxy's timeout could
would occastionally race and the backend mock would be able to cough up a
chunk before the timeout fired in the proxy - typically resulting in a failed
assertion like " lalala" != 'lalala'.

We paramaterize the timeout value, and bump it up for those cases where we are
expecting to hit the timeout.  Timing shows this change is just as fast for
passing tests.  And if you want to break the node_timeout in
proxy.controller.base you can verify the tests are still just as effective -
if a bit slower to detect the failure path.

Fixes bug #1272509

Change-Id: Iaf91d9d551e94fc317a08e8c0ee02daeed331b60

commit_message:
Remove backwards compatability in setup-baremetal

TripleO CI now populates the nodes array in the JSON datafile, so the
backward compatability code in setup-baremetal can be removed.

As an added bonus, nodes that specify more than one MAC address will
have all of them registered with nova-bm.

Change-Id: I7b8e7b67694319e377df400b122f16bff9e15370

commit_message:
Add 'methods' to all v3 test tokens

methods is a required field of v3 tokens but none of the sample tokens
have them. This field is required for determining the difference between
a v2 and a v3 AccessInfo object.

Adding full support for integrating Keystone via LDAP. Enables

 - Add two examples of LDAP configuration, although LDAP environments
   are highly variable, these will help get everyone started
 - Modify the keystone::ldap class to support all LDAP related options
 - Check sane defaults in the keystone::ldap class to hopefully reduce mistakes

 - Modify the LDAP test to match the new class

Change-Id: Ie6879eb4816fd2b906f72cac8deb3b62bd4b2430
'}]
commit_message:
Full support for Keystone LDAP integration

Adding full support for integrating Keystone via LDAP. Enables
support for managing all LDAP related Keystone options.

 - Add two examples of LDAP configuration, although LDAP environments
   are highly variable, these will help get everyone started
 - Modify the keystone::ldap class to support all LDAP related options
 - Check sane defaults in the keystone::ldap class to hopefully reduce mistakes
 - Add a dependency on the python-ldap package
 - Modify the LDAP test to match the new class
 - Make the default-tenant optional since some LDAP backends do not
   support this

Change-Id: Ie6879eb4816fd2b906f72cac8deb3b62bd4b2430

subject: Use updated request_id middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-14 05:10:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/middleware/request_id.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Use updated request_id middleware

The request_id middleware from oslo had a bug that would cause it to
sometimes use the wrong value for the x-openstack-request-id response
header when handling multiple requests. The fix for this bug changed
how the middleware operates, and it is now responsibility of the
application to attach the header.

This change syncs the updated middleware and includes the alterations
necessary to use it.

Closes-bug: 1289696
Change-Id: Ifdee53cfcf41f29071e86df7b174ac2f091039da
'}]
commit_message:
Use updated request_id middleware

The request_id middleware from oslo had a bug that would cause it to
sometimes use the wrong value for the x-openstack-request-id response
header when handling multiple requests. The fix for this bug changed
how the middleware operates, and it is now responsibility of the
application to attach the header.

This change syncs the updated middleware and includes the alterations
necessary to use it.

Closes-bug: 1289696
Change-Id: Ifdee53cfcf41f29071e86df7b174ac2f091039da

subject: Make bin/swift testable part 1
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-25 11:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Make bin/swift testable part 1

To make bin/swift importable for testing it needs to be renamed/moved.
The final idea is to move it to swiftclient/shell.py and add only a stub
in bin/swift to import swiftclient/shell.py.

However, doing this in a single step makes reviewing very hard, because
now there are > 1400 lines deleted from bin/swift and added to
swiftclient/shell.py - Gerrit doesn't detect the moved file.

For example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73710/2/

This patch first moves the code to swiftclient/shell.py and uses
setup.py/cfg to create the stub file in bin/swift. A follow up
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76489/) will then add the stub itself
in bin/swift (and remove the entry in setup.py).

The change to tox.ini is related to bug 1290562 and can be removed in
the future.

Change-Id: Id86392ccaf09e1d80a5d808fb49827d6d18c2588
"}]
commit_message:
Make bin/swift testable part 1

To make bin/swift importable for testing it needs to be renamed/moved.
The final idea is to move it to swiftclient/shell.py and add only a stub
in bin/swift to import swiftclient/shell.py.

However, doing this in a single step makes reviewing very hard, because
now there are > 1400 lines deleted from bin/swift and added to
swiftclient/shell.py - Gerrit doesn't detect the moved file.

For example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73710/2/

This patch first moves the code to swiftclient/shell.py and uses
setup.py/cfg to create the stub file in bin/swift. A follow up
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76489/) will then add the stub itself
in bin/swift (and remove the entry in setup.py).

The change to tox.ini is related to bug 1290562 and can be removed in
the future.

Change-Id: Id86392ccaf09e1d80a5d808fb49827d6d18c2588

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-25 10:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/service.py', 'nova/debugger.py', 'nova/cmd/__init__.py', 'tools/xenserver/vm_vdi_cleaner.py', 'nova/config.py'], 'message': "Re-work how debugger CLI opts are registered

CLI options must be registered before the command line is parsed or a
cfg.ArgsAlreadyParsedError is raised.

Since commit 2cbea24 we are registering two 'remote_debug' arguments
in nova.service. In commit b506529, we see a hack being added to
ensure that nova.service is imported and the CLI opts registered
before config.parse_args() is called.

To clean this up somewhat, refactor all the elements of this remote
debugger support into nova.debugger. Avoid importing modules at
module import time since we need to import this before monkey
patching. Add a function for registering the CLI options just before
config.parse_args() is called. And fail gracefully if the CLI options
aren't registered when we called debugger.init().

Note that because the options aren't registered at module import time
any more, the config generator doesn't pick them up. However, that's
actually a good thing since this support doesn't work if you enable it
via config files since debugger.enabled() only looks at the command
line.

DocImpact: remote_debug options are not available via the config file,
only via the command line.

Change-Id: I97f747a2fb9222137203657df1d86ba89f3219e2
"}]
commit_message:
Re-work how debugger CLI opts are registered

CLI options must be registered before the command line is parsed or a
cfg.ArgsAlreadyParsedError is raised.

Since commit 2cbea24 we are registering two 'remote_debug' arguments
in nova.service. In commit b506529, we see a hack being added to
ensure that nova.service is imported and the CLI opts registered
before config.parse_args() is called.

To clean this up somewhat, refactor all the elements of this remote
debugger support into nova.debugger. Avoid importing modules at
module import time since we need to import this before monkey
patching. Add a function for registering the CLI options just before
config.parse_args() is called. And fail gracefully if the CLI options
aren't registered when we called debugger.init().

Note that because the options aren't registered at module import time
any more, the config generator doesn't pick them up. However, that's
actually a good thing since this support doesn't work if you enable it
via config files since debugger.enabled() only looks at the command
line.

DocImpact: remote_debug options are not available via the config file,
only via the command line.

Change-Id: I97f747a2fb9222137203657df1d86ba89f3219e2

subject: Fix envutils.get_global (prev. default_deployment_id) errors management
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-26 16:32:31.000000000', 'files': ['tests/cmd/test_envutils.py', 'rally/cmd/envutils.py', 'tests/cmd/test_manage.py'], 'message': "Fix envutils.get_global (prev. default_deployment_id) errors management

* Since envutils.get_global doesn't raise anymore 'InvalidArgumentsException'
(due to this fix https://launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1291298) we are encountering
issues when get_global simply returns None. That's why the bool parameter
doRaise was added to get_global, so when needed the method will raise
'InvalidArgumentsException' and in the case of #1291298 get_global won't raise
any exception and will simply return None.
* Fixed unit test of Tempest Install command, deploy_id was always None in the
unit test and once the above modification applied, an InvalidArgumentsException
was raised which caused the failing of the test.

Change-Id: I18e2ac99e6412c3ae67769390e390d4210243381
Closes-Bug: #1293454
"}]
commit_message:
Fix envutils.get_global (prev. default_deployment_id) errors management

* Since envutils.get_global doesn't raise anymore 'InvalidArgumentsException'
(due to this fix https://launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1291298) we are encountering
issues when get_global simply returns None. That's why the bool parameter
doRaise was added to get_global, so when needed the method will raise
'InvalidArgumentsException' and in the case of #1291298 get_global won't raise
any exception and will simply return None.
* Fixed unit test of Tempest Install command, deploy_id was always None in the
unit test and once the above modification applied, an InvalidArgumentsException
was raised which caused the failing of the test.

Change-Id: I18e2ac99e6412c3ae67769390e390d4210243381
Closes-Bug: #1293454

The NSX sync backend previously passed around a sqlalchemy model object

(cherry picked from commit 084b7f62280241a9037b6f9e592c466135e5fec1)

commit_message:
NSX: Sync do not pass around model object

The NSX sync backend previously passed around a sqlalchemy model object
around which was nice because we did not need to query the database an
additional time to update the status of an object.

Unfortunately, this was add done within a db transaction which included a
call to NSX which could cause deadlock this needed to be removed. Now a
dict is passed around instead and proper transaction handling
is used when updating objects.

Closes-bug: #1281772

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/nicira/common/sync.py

Change-Id: Id50abd8f2143b127d1ca81c360c1c6d400e1d74f
(cherry picked from commit 084b7f62280241a9037b6f9e592c466135e5fec1)

commit_message:
NSX: Fix possible deadlock in sync code

This patch removes the call to nsx from within the db transcation
which can cause deadlock if another request comes in during this time.

Closes-bug: #1278991
Change-Id: If16b53a77997bccfdff2554dead26f42e23eaec9
(cherry picked from commit d59d5a1c72c2324b857225680f5578d381a2ec73)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-25 12:59:10.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Use OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH in devstack-vm-gate.sh

When a change on master branch triggered a stable job,
the stable job's localrc configured according to the
master rules instead of the stable rules.

For example: The stable/havana job on the devstack-gate changes
attempted to install trove, which was not part of the integrated
set at the havana time.
It is also caused failures on the stable/havana postgresql jobs.

We saw similar issues on the periodic jobs as well.

The issue can be solved by using the OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH, instead of
ZUUL_BRANCH.

devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh always defines the OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH.

Change-Id: Id49f9730a2feeca51dee057d5aec6968a9f62bb3
"}]
commit_message:
Use OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH in devstack-vm-gate.sh

When a change on master branch triggered a stable job,
the stable job's localrc configured according to the
master rules instead of the stable rules.

For example: The stable/havana job on the devstack-gate changes
attempted to install trove, which was not part of the integrated
set at the havana time.
It is also caused failures on the stable/havana postgresql jobs.

We saw similar issues on the periodic jobs as well.

The issue can be solved by using the OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH, instead of
ZUUL_BRANCH.

devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh always defines the OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH.

Change-Id: Id49f9730a2feeca51dee057d5aec6968a9f62bb3

into the language specified in the HTTP requests headers.

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-03-26 15:46:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/v3/client.py'], 'message': 'Adds to Keystone to convert V2 endpoints to V3

The Domain Quota Management Driver uses the V3 Authentication Token.
Also, it tries to contact Keystone for getting list of projects in a
domain using V3 API like /v3/projects?domain_id=<id>. But the
keystone v3/client.py default uses V2 API and hence code changed
to convert V2 endpoints for V3 endpoints. This change is required
to implement blue print domain-quota-driver-api

Change-Id: If62ffc5e5252477bbe4d80f14c0a7653e11d5403
Closes-Bug: 1260916
'}]
commit_message:
Adds to Keystone to convert V2 endpoints to V3

The Domain Quota Management Driver uses the V3 Authentication Token.
Also, it tries to contact Keystone for getting list of projects in a
domain using V3 API like /v3/projects?domain_id=<id>. But the
keystone v3/client.py default uses V2 API and hence code changed
to convert V2 endpoints for V3 endpoints. This change is required
to implement blue print domain-quota-driver-api

Change-Id: If62ffc5e5252477bbe4d80f14c0a7653e11d5403
Closes-Bug: 1260916

commit_message:

subject: 4.1.1 Fixed issue with parrallel tests execution
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-26 15:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/murano.py'], 'message': '4.1.1 Fixed issue with parrallel tests execution

When user runs several types of OSTF tests, these tests can be run
in parallel and in the result tearDown method deletes all environment
and some tests will fail. To avoid this we will generate new name
for each new environment and we should also delete only this environment
in tearDown method.

Change-Id: I12f1e797eceefe11dda50ab61aabe15ab9036931
Closes-Bug: #1285562
'}]
commit_message:
4.1.1 Fixed issue with parrallel tests execution

When user runs several types of OSTF tests, these tests can be run
in parallel and in the result tearDown method deletes all environment
and some tests will fail. To avoid this we will generate new name
for each new environment and we should also delete only this environment
in tearDown method.

Change-Id: I12f1e797eceefe11dda50ab61aabe15ab9036931
Closes-Bug: #1285562

commit_message:
Add dib-lint script

This will provide a place to put checks that catch common errors
in elements.  To start, this just checks that files starting with
a shebang are chmod +x so they can actually be run.

commit_message:
do not create radosgw region map in post-deploy

RadosGW region map may intermittently get corrupted when it is created
during post-deployment, leading to RadosGW being unable to start.

Change-Id: I9587b983ad50d74d22eb157b5d98a6f709e58b23
Related-bug: #1287166

commit_message:
Change NOVA_VIF_DRIVER for ml2 with NeutronFirewallVIFDriver

In Icehouse, Neturon + OVS + Nova + Iptables based security group
is broken. As a workaround fix, we introduced NeturonFirewallVIFDriver.
In this commit, we will apply this as a defualt for ML2 plugin

This is nova side related fix
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/82904/

Change-Id: I45f9b4652bae6b47ff4b01007ad0d97f1e12e1ae
Related-bug: 1297469

commit_message:
multi backends: factorize code between single and multi backends

Code is duplicated between single volume backend
(cinder::volume::*) and multi backends (cinder::backend::*).
This commits updates the single volume backends to make use
of the respective multiple backends classes.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-25 17:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "Don't attempt to fill faults for instance_list if FlavorNotFound

When getting a list of servers with details, if a FlavorNotFound is
raised from the compute API the local instance_list variable is set to
an empty list, but later instance_list.fill_faults() is called on it
assuming it is an InstanceList object, which will cause an
AttributeError.

This patch just checks to see if instance_list is empty before calling
fill_faults since InstanceList.fill_faults assumes the list is not empty
when called, so it's not trivial to simply create an empty InstanceList
here and set it to the instance_list variable.

The new test cases use testtools.matchers.HasLength and while seeing
if testtools was imported I noticed it (along with mox) was in the
wrong import group, so also fixed the order there.

This patch also fixes the test_get_server_details_empty unit test to
actually call the detail method rather than index.

Closes-Bug: #1296940

Change-Id: I9f85c2a0b70f41e5bba2da05a2339caf2a8efc3e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't attempt to fill faults for instance_list if FlavorNotFound

When getting a list of servers with details, if a FlavorNotFound is
raised from the compute API the local instance_list variable is set to
an empty list, but later instance_list.fill_faults() is called on it
assuming it is an InstanceList object, which will cause an
AttributeError.

This patch just checks to see if instance_list is empty before calling
fill_faults since InstanceList.fill_faults assumes the list is not empty
when called, so it's not trivial to simply create an empty InstanceList
here and set it to the instance_list variable.

The new test cases use testtools.matchers.HasLength and while seeing
if testtools was imported I noticed it (along with mox) was in the
wrong import group, so also fixed the order there.

This patch also fixes the test_get_server_details_empty unit test to
actually call the detail method rather than index.

Closes-Bug: #1296940

Change-Id: I9f85c2a0b70f41e5bba2da05a2339caf2a8efc3e

commit_message:
Catch InstanceNotFound exceptions for V2 API floating_ips

Adds handling of InstanceNotFound exceptions in the V2 API
floating_ips extension and translate them to HTTPNotFound rather
than letting them propogate and causing a traceback in the logs

Co-Authored-By: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: Idc1a5b2e6b8cb9778d032e5e1fc8112a65fc225c
Closes-Bug: 1271047

subject: Avoid using .values() on the indexed columns

The length of a dict-like object should be the same as the length of the

here.

Change-Id: I625dc7dea00cc8f09c68ea104c5c64c5f39fffc0

commit_message:
Avoid using .values() on the indexed columns

The length of a dict-like object should be the same as the length of the
list of values in the object, so calling .values() should be unnecessary
here.

Change-Id: I625dc7dea00cc8f09c68ea104c5c64c5f39fffc0
Closes-Bug: 1297059

commit_message:
SQLAlchemy requirements put in order

- require SQLAlchemy>=0.7.8 if no stricter requirement present;
- allow SQLAlhchemy 0.9.x in python 3.3 and pypy test environments.

commit_message:
Fix wait_for_tarball 'None' error

Due to delays in the prerelease queue, wait_for_tarball would sometimes
shortcircuit and return 'None' jobs, or timeout completely. This fixes
both issues.

Change-Id: Iac054a2b22d8db1cf0d543c8ac0fdf432ea08490

commit_message:
Use same code to reset flow and parts of it

Instead of having special engine and storage method to reset
reverted flow when running it again, delegate the job to
graph action, which already does almost same thing when retrying
subgraphs.

Change-Id: Icf257cfc0fb161ab2199baa3d7c7e64664a109e7

subject: Optimize dependency links in flattening
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-26 09:28:12.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_analyzer.py', 'taskflow/utils/flow_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_retries.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_flattening.py'], 'message': 'Optimize dependency links in flattening

With this change a link between two subflows caused by task dependency
does not impose execution ordering between all tasks of that subflows
any more: only provider and consumer of the dependency are now linked.
For some cases this is a major optimization, as it allows more
independent parts of the flow to be executed or reverted in parallel. It
also allows, for example, converting parts of flow into subflows without
loosing performance.

Because with this change parts of parent flow that depend on some tasks
in subflow can be executed before all tasks in the subflow are
completed, graph analyzer is changed to not stop at subflow border when
iterating subgraphs.

Change-Id: I45587a4e851febe3c43cfa7b74bdfc50f61e0279
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize dependency links in flattening

With this change a link between two subflows caused by task dependency
does not impose execution ordering between all tasks of that subflows
any more: only provider and consumer of the dependency are now linked.
For some cases this is a major optimization, as it allows more
independent parts of the flow to be executed or reverted in parallel. It
also allows, for example, converting parts of flow into subflows without
loosing performance.

Because with this change parts of parent flow that depend on some tasks
in subflow can be executed before all tasks in the subflow are
completed, graph analyzer is changed to not stop at subflow border when
iterating subgraphs.

Change-Id: I45587a4e851febe3c43cfa7b74bdfc50f61e0279
